text: My boyfriend and I had been wanting to stop by for months. We finally had the opportunity last night and had a wonderful meal. My boyfriend is from back east and misses the mom and pop restaurant. We finally found it here! The food was amazing and the service is excellent! We have found our place we want to be regulars at!

The 1st time my family and I went there, we loved the food. The 2nd time we went they were closed during business hours an there was a note saying they closed at 4 that day.The last time we went, I called first to make sure they were open.  She assured me they were open and would be til 10:00 PM.  Upon arrival an hour later, , we noticed no cars in the parking lot and it was dark.  There was a note on the door saying they were closed early....AGAIN!!
I'm no business owner, but I do know this is no way to run a business, closing early whenever they want, not being open during business hours, saying over the phone they were open til 10 and then closing early.It was unexcusable behavior on their part and not much business sense and I've got to say that after giving them 3 chances, they lost us as customers.  Since they never want to stay open for their loyal customers, we are never going back. The food was good but their business sense is questionable.  Before you head out there, I would call first, but I guarantee they will be closed anyway!

Gave this place a shot. My boyfriend and I always see it when we are driving to and from each other's houses. I was craving biscuits and gravy so this place fit the bill.

They are decent prices and I actually enjoyed the food more than Egg Works. The biscuits and gravy platter was huge and I ate every bite. My boyfriend got the chicken fried chicken and waffles and that was delicious too! The waffle was fluffy and chicken wasn't pounded too thin. 

I would come back in a heartbeat and try one of the Hashes that they offer as well. Please keep up the fast and friendly service. Food came out in a short time, was hot and they even offered to fill my coffee several times.
Chicken Fried Chicken I've had the food was hot the chicken was tender good flavor best breakfast I've had in a very long time looking forward to trying lunch and dinner

These clowns are on uber eats.  Promised 20 minute delivery.  Waited an hour then they cancelled my order without explanation.  Don't participate in uber eats if you can't fulfill orders.  Thanks for wasting my time.
Awesome little diner. We just wanted a small sit down restaurant with American food away from the strip. The pulled pork hash was amazing!

Very nice people that are running the restaurant. We had the chicken fried chicken with waffles!!! Very tasty. Waffle light and buttery and the chicken was friend just right!! The waitress and her husband are the owners. Very pleasant. Would go back. Prices are great! Nice to get away from the strip.

I just stopped by this new place called Hometown Eats yesterday. It was a Sunday morning and it was busy and i thought it would be a while before i was seated but to my surprise i was greeted immediately and ushered to my table. After taking my drink order i was looking at the menu and ordered The Southwestern Hash which was quite delightful. Overall i had a great experience and i cant wait to tell my husband that this little diamond in the rough exist!

Excellent restaurant. Ingredients are fresh and quality. I had the spaghetti and meatballs. Spaghetti was perfectly cooked and the sauce was excellent. Specials looked really good, but I wanted spaghetti. Service is great. I'll be back!

Looking for Denny's for breakfast and found this gem!  Glad I did!  The food was delicious!  A bit understaffed but I hope she can find the right folks to help her out.  Oh and this is a back to back visit for me.
Went here last Saturday. The staff was friendly, the food was excellent, the portions were big, the price was Very reasonable. Awesome biscuits and gravy!!
Excellent breakfast with healthy choices. I love that their food is cooked with minimal oil.  Omelette and oatmeal were outstanding!

Love love. So good. Ordered chicken fried chicken. Basket of fried. Chicken was juicy. Fries are freshly cut. Delicious. Staff is very friendly and handsome. Nice and clean inside, with plenty of parking. We will be back for sure.

Was very excited to try this place after reading the reviews, the Service was amazing the waitress was very friendly however I ordered the Taco Salad and it literally came with a hamburger patty on top (not seasoned) , a few corn chips and what appeared to be a whole head of lettuce in my bowl, no dressing and I had to ask for the Sour cream and Avocado which they were out of ... I only had a bite and the waitress was kind enough to remove the salad  Great customer service. I'll be back to try something different

First and foremost, the prices on the menu link on Yelp are not even remotely close.  I got the French Dip sandwich and it was $10.50.  The price at the menu link said $6.49.  Granted, it came with fries for that price but that's still a pretty large difference.  To be fair, the menu is not their official menu but you should be aware that what's here is way low.

As to the quality of the sandwich: meh...  It was pot roast with cheese melted on it.  It was served on a toasted bun.  I was struck by the size of the sandwich.  The bun was about the size of a hot dog bun and the meat and cheese didn't cover it.  For that price, I would expect a large sub roll packed with meat.  The flavor wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything special.  One other thing to note, the "au jus" that came with the sandwich was, for lack of a better term, weird.  It was pale yellow in color and was essentially flavorless.  The fries that came with the sandwich were also pretty mediocre.  Lot's of small pieces.

My daughter got a hamburger with bacon and said she enjoyed it.  Although, the menu pricing was way off on this item too.  It was $6.79 with fries while the price on the menu was $2.99 without fries.

Our bill for a sandwich, a burger (with bacon) and two drinks was $25.  That's pretty expensive for a so-so lunch.  We won't be back.

At a friends suggestion, we tried this place. We were told we had to try the chicken fried steak, sloppy joe sliders and the beef stroganoff. We've gone here about 7 or 8 times now and have had the chance to try all theee and all I can say is wow!  Chicken friend steak is soooo good. Sloppy joes are mouth watering and the beef stroganoff is to die for!!!! So while the food is absolutely amazing, the owner is so friendly and makes you feel at home. The ambience is quirky and fun. Old diner feel with 60's music.  I hope this place does well. I would hate to see it go away like so many other business at this location.

We've been waiting expectantly for Rex's new location to open & have not been disappointed on any of our recent trips! It's always been one of our to-go breakfast places & look forward to trying dinner there as well.

Great staff, keep your coffee cup filled! My hubby loves the breakfast sandwich & says the sausage is great. I love the veggie omelet & their homefries- the salsa verde is yummy! We enjoy the spacious new digs & hope to enjoy many years of delicious meals here!

My lady and I had breakfast here I had the pancakes with 2 eggs and bacon my girl had the taco salad and it didn't take us long to clear those place the service is great and friendly and so is the management I'm looking forward to going there for lunch sometime in the near future... To management and servers Great Job!!

I was there for lunch - they seem to specialize in breakfast and/or chicken fried steak.  I decided on the appetizer - Sliders.  menu stated that I could order 1 of each of the four selections.  Waiter say 'no', can't do that.  'They were in the process of changing the menu'  (Menu is typed out on old dirty plain paper on a clip board).  I then order 2 each of sloppy joes and pulled pork sliders.  After 35 minutes, I still had no food.  I left.
Will never go back.

This is a great place to eat. The food is great and so is the customer service. My grandmother and I went for lunch today, she got the fish tacos and she really liked them. I on the other hand got the chicken tenders and they were great. Our waitress Karla was great and made sure that we were happy with our food. I will definitely be going back to eat here.

Ever since Kailyns has closed we've been trying to find a diner in the area. Guess we'll have to keep searching.  There was nothing special about the menu or the food. Everything was barely warm and very bland. And it took a while for food to arrive.

Every now and then you walk into a restaurant and immediately feel at home. You realize that even if the food were horrible, the vibe alone simply made you happier.
This is that place, with the added benefit of really quality food. 
I had the biscuits and gravy, which came with 2 eggs and hash browns. I almost licked my plate! 
For this neighborhood, there is nothing like this place, and it is a must go. I imagine this is what Blueberry Hill aspired to be when they were first founded.
And oh, by the way, ask for any fresh baked cakes or pies for desert......

What a wonderful breakfast. Found this place using Yelp. Needed a spot for a business breakfast. What a find. I had the chicken fried steak with eggs. Best hash browns I have had in years - maybe ever. I am not exaggerating. My partner had ... I don't know, who cares, my breakfast was great. Whatever he had he loved. We stopped talking and just enjoyed. 
Gravy like you seldom get in a restaurant. When I come back to LV I will come back here. 
The place was clean and service was great.
I come to this place every time I come to Vegas. Our whole bill was the same as just one plate on the Strip. The chicken fried steak it's the Best!

Mine and Justin's first time coming here. We always pass it going home and have always wanted to try this place. So we went on a Sunday morning and the parking lot looked packed. The wait was only 15 minutes, maybe even less! While we were trying to decide what we wanted to eat, we looked up photos on yelped and decided to try the mac 'n cheese, the chicken club, and the southwestern brisket hash...and let me tell ya..EVERYTHING IS DELICIOUS! The food looked average, but the flavors were awesome! Definitely would recommend this place to others and come back soon. The pricing wasn't even bad either!
I love this place. The food does not have a long wait time and comes out amazing . I love the BLT. Most people get the country fried steak from what I've seen. The staff is extremely nice !

My whole family and I have been going to this restaurant since it was at it's old location on West Lake Mead and we honestly love it. The staff is so nice and prices are very reasonable. My boyfriend and I are college students and I don't cook so money is tight and this place accommodates our budget. The vibe inside feels like home, the owner always makes sure everyone is always is happy, and everyone is so welcoming.  

At the new location I had the steak and eggs and it was delicious. The steak was not dry at all and it was very flavorful. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles and he loved them. The waffles were pretty big. We got the check without having to ask for it which is great. I hate asking for them. 

As for the televisions, if you don't want to watch something you can ask to change the channel. They will gladly do so! It's not that big of a deal. I just had to state that. 

Overall we have been enjoying this place, and will keep enjoying it.

My husband and I came in to hometown cafe for breakfast. We both ordered the ham and eggs, which came with hometown potatoes or  hash browns that had sauteed onions on top., we had the hash browns. The food was very tasty . We will definitely come back again to check out lunch and dinner.

I ordered the French toast and it was horrible. It was six small flattened out white bread not "Texas toast" that was burned like it came out of a toaster. I didn't enjoy it at all. I will never be back to eat there anytime soon. Only went there cause I heard it was really good and I went to give it a try. If you go here avoid the simple foods like French toast. I hope they can cook pancakes better at least.

Wow...I'm surprised to see so many 5 star reviews... Guess we went on a bad day. We were seated at a dirty table, the waiter was not caring or efficient at all, the "crispy" fish sandwich was soggy, and I don't believe the prices were fair for the quality of food and service we received. The atmosphere in general was ok and the fries were actually pretty good...but we won't be going back. Hope I don't get raked over the coals for giving a bad review to this establishment since so many others seem to love it...i was eager to try this restaurant even though the last two times we tried to eat there they were closed for different reasons.

Plenty of great Yelp reviews so that is how I stumbled in to this cozy restaurant. I really like the country style decor. We were greeted and taken to our table. The lay out of the tables is great very evenly spaced and plenty of booths. You can also sit on the counter; great for single diners. 

I had two things that I wanted to try. Either the chicken fried steak or new your steak breakfast. I orders the fried version and I am glad I did. Here is why; the steak was fried to perfection and the breading was perfect. Super crispy and just enough flavor to go with the gravy. Eggs cooked to order. I opted for the English muffin instead of toast and I am happy that I did. The muffin was toasted perfectly. Home potatoes was awesome. Next time I will ask for hash browns. The breading on the steak is what I really enjoyed. I would have to say that this is in the top 3 of my chicken fried steak list and I am picky when it comes to my chicken fried steak. I just wished they offered grits.

Service was good. Took a while to get a waiter for our order but I was offered drinks immediately. My coffee was refilled 2x without asking. It's a very good sign of great service. I see some yelpers has issues with service but it may be an isolated incident. The food came out on time and it was appetizingly presented on a plate.

I really want this place to be successful because the people here are nice and it's a small business - not a chain. The food is awesome. I want to try other things and I will definitely be back. Price to value is good. They do not have a kids menu but I don't think it's a deal breaker. Not a big deal. 

Just a note; they have early bird and lunch specials.

Cute place. Family owned and operated. Food is great, not over complicated. Handsome young wait staff and remember for me that is a plus always. The decor is a mix of country kitchen and 50's diner. Fun, family atmosphere. A must try.

Today at about 2pm my husband and I came into this establishment. We found it by driving home from work a couple of weeks ago. So finally we wanted to try something new so we remembered this small place down the street. We walked in, great 50's theme, clean, and very polite staff. We got seated very quickly as to the restaurant wasn't completely full. We wondered why and then we noticed we can in within an hour of closing. We were approached by hostess who took our drink order. After we took forever to decide on a food order. The menu was amazing, but was a little hard because we didn't have any pictures to go off of so we used Yelp. We ordered a chicken burrito with green sauce. It came with retried beans, and Spanish rice. Also a carnita burrito with red sauce with retried beans with Spanish rice. A waffle with sausage, and chili cheese fries. That meal was so amazing we actually decided to make it our spot. All their food is fresh never frozen and cooked to order. Being nine months pregnant made my son happy too! Especially they fresh oj. If you were iffy on your decision to come here don't be. You won't be disappointed!

This is a review on their breakfast only.

Great little spot close to my house in my hometown. We decided to try something new for breakfast and tried this place. We really liked the service and the food. They had a very small staff in the morning but we were seated quickly and got to order quickly too. The food did not take too long too which is great for breakfast place. 

I ordered the pulled pork hash and it was delicious. I loved all the unique stuff on the menu. I am going to go back and order the chili verde omelet which they said was a customer favorite.

I was treated to breakfast here the past weekend. The service was very good and I always appreciate that when I'm out to eat. The biscuits and gravy were OK. The gravy was fairly good, but I wish they put sausage in it. My friend was raving about the patty melt, which I love to eat, so she ordered that to go to be sure I tried it. It was delicious. I especially loved the mushrooms, which haven''t been typical in the patty melts that I've had, and the unique sauce. It was also surprisingly juicy. I would definitely like to go back and try one fresh off the grill.
HORRIBLE service.  One table out of about ten actually had food, all others waiting and there appeared to be only one server. We walked out without ever ordering.

Great food and even better service. The people here are genuinely good people that love what they do and they do it well. The chicken fried steak is tender and just the right size. The new location is nice and clean and very roomy.
Pretty cool place. Food was good at fair prices. Food came out nice and quick but took awhile to get the check. I love the atmosphere overall.

We saw the reviews on yelp and thought we'd give it a go.  I'm sure glad we did. Our group ate here a couple of times - brisket and country fried steak.  It really doesn't get any better than this.  The service is a bit slow, but very friendly. And the food is diner perfect. Average brunch menu items is around $11 but it's worth it.
Excellent food, great service, a good option for breakfast, all fresh and delicious !!!

I recently went here for the first time. The reviews on here plus the photos convinced me to try Hometown Eats. I ordered a ham and cheese omelette. I can say without reservation that this was the worst omelette I have ever had. I believe the eggs were cooked in a microwave with no seasoning and then cold ham and cheese was folded inside after the eggs were cooked. The cheese was not melted and the ham was cold. 

I believe the ability to properly cook eggs is a measure of a chef and this one failed miserably.

We first discovered Hometown classic American eats in Henderson my family and I love it, amazing food, friendly staff and great prices. Their new location is even better love the decor and food as great as it could be. we were just there this past Sunday and we got seated right away got our drinks fast I got a Bloody Mary wow delicious, we are a family of 5 and we ordered  a lot of food and ate every single bite of it, we had a great brunch I will definitely be back and please if you stop by try their delicious Clam chowder soup DELICIOUS!!!
Had same experience as Jane P. & haven't been back since, that was when they first opened but I might try again someday.

This place is just flat out great. I have been Herr for breakfast, lunch and dinner. every meal was very good and the service is excellent. the owner and wife are supper friendly. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a great dinner experience at fair prices. recommend the chicken and waffles my favorite dish.

This place is great for brakefast! Really good pancakes, their ham was a little thin but it was good, the place has small town feeling! Fresh flowers on the table and cute coffee cups!                       I was surprised that they weren't that busy tho

Best food ever... Nice and friendly staff.
We ate with them since old location.
My son loves "Biscuit and Gravy" here..
He doesn't want to eat anywhere but only here !!

Just like grandma used to make. The place reminds me of my grandmothers house. The food is awesome. I had the early bird special. I got the biscuits and gravy plate with 2 eggs, home fries and bacon. Every bite was delicious. My coffee got cold because I couldn't put my fork down. No problem though. They were super servers and got me some fresh hot coffee. From the moment I walked in I was greeted with smiles and felt welcomed. I can't believe this place is not packed wall to wall like a night club with $2 shots. Alejandra served me and she is awesome. Thanks for a great experience. I will be back on my next visit.

First time eating here and we just happened upon it. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very light. The decor is a mix of country/Americana, it is very bright and cheery. The staff is very friendly, very smiley and extremely attentive and we didn't have to ask for anything. The dining area was impeccable, so were the bathrooms. The food was delicious, everything was hot and tasted like it was just made, with fresh ingredients. We really enjoyed everything. This restaurant is my top choice if I'm ever back in this area. And btw, we got jellybeans with our checks! I like that little detail. Overall this was a very pleasant experience.

What a charming little eatery.  Staff was so friendly upon entering.

I came across this place from my fellow yelpers and since I trust you guys so much I knew I had nothing to worry about. 

I ate the pulled pork breakfast plate.  My eggs were cooked perfectly.  Since I ask for over medium eggs I know it's hit or miss with most places.   Pulled pork was savory and the green sauce was just spicy enough. It was topped with potatoes and cheese that set it off.

I will certainly be back

This place is so good!! Our server was super nice and the owner was super sweet and helpful! You can definitely tell this place is family owned because of how much they care and how clean the place is! We had fish sticks, chicken club, and a bacon cheeseburger and everyone loved their items! Will definitely recommend and be back!

This place is awesome. All the food is prepared from scratch. This is my 4th trip into this place and the food and service is consistently excellent. Chicken fried steak and eggs are very good. Definitely a go to place for a good breakfast or lunch.

This is my absolute go to place! If this place was a little closer to my house I would go here everyday! First of, I love the atmosphere. The home decor and music being played. Feels like I'm at a diner back in the day. Second, the employees are just friendly and very welcoming. You don't get that a lot especially in food places but everyone here is so friendly and fast! They come to our needs before we even think of it! 

Pricing: the price is very affordable especially with the amount of food you get. My boyfriend always gets steak and eggs and it's $11.99 with homemade hash brown. He said it is the best steak and eggs w/ hash brown with the price. Also, I believe it's Monday-Friday where if your purchase an adult meal and you have a kid. Kids eat free! 

Food: the first time my family and I ate at this place I definitely ordered your basic pancakes and eggs and let me tell you! Those pancakes were really good! Then I started ordering the beef stroganoff and there's no going back. Best beef stroganoff ever! 

So next time you're debating to find the perfect breakfast or brunch this is the place to go. Affordable, fast & delicious!

So when we got there, there was only one couple waiting to be seated. After we had waited about 10 minutes, a few other people had come in and were waiting as well. The original couple asked a passing waitress, whom I later found out her name was Jackie, when they can get their to-go order that they had already been waiting for at least 20 minutes. Jackie was REALLY extra snooty saying, "I am right now the busboy, the server, and the cashier!" Then she walked away. And there was a busboy and a busgirl there helping so I knew it wasn't all true. 
Me and my two friends laughed to ourselves when she walked away and said that we hoped she wasn't our server. She was! While waiting to be sat we looked at the menus. They keep a large unkempt pile of them for you to grab off the unoccupied hostess stand. The menus are basically printed on paper kept in a clipboard, fine I guess but it shouldn't be soooo many pages long. 
We finally got sat, got to the table and the seat has a huge rip in it. Repaired with red duct tape to match the red seat. This is a repair job of approximately 12"x6". For a newer restaurant, I'm surprised. So anyways, Jackie comes over to take our orders. She asked each of us what we wanted without ever writing it down. Then asked each of us a second time what we wanted while writing it down! Why not do it the first time? Anyways, so she goes away. She comes back about 5 minutes later and says that she had written our order on a menu and not on her pad of paper and didn't know what happened to our order. So she had to take it down again.
So she goes off with our order. We wait. And wait. And wait. By the way, the waiting area is completely full but there are many many cleaned tables that noone was using. They obviously needed more servers, or maybe some were out sick. I don't know but Jackie seemed to be covering everywhere.
We get our food 35 minutes after being seated. And remember only 10 or 11 tables were seated and half of them already had their food. Two of the three orders were wrong. The pancakes were just so so. Also the pancakes had powdered sugar on them which I assume is an additional mistake since I ordered regular pancakes. My eggs, undercooked. The wrong potatoes on one of the other plates, the wrong syrup (I asked for sugar free and received regular). The eggs on the eggs benedict were overcooked, no runny yolk at all. 
All in all a bad experience. Maybe it is a good place, but on this Sunday about 12:30pm on 5/15/16 it was a horrible experience.
This place has not list any of its charm since moving from the Lake Mead location. Its still just as charming! The quality of the food hasn't suffered either. Still great food for a great price.

We used to go to their restaurant back at Water Street, now it's a drive going here. But it's always awesome food and service! This place is charming and has a cozy diner vibe. It's close to the airport so I suggest if you are coming home from a trip or simply visiting i recommend to try this place. I just hope they will open another branch closer to us.

Found this place on Yelp and LOVE it. My wife and I enjoy the variety and quality of the food. We have had the chicken and waffles, brisket sandwich, fish and chips, and pulled pork. All of the dishes were awesome. Definitely has a fresh home cooked flavor. Favorite thing on the menu is there mac and cheese. It is usually pretty quiet and comfortable.

This place is great if you're looking for a small town type of dining experience. When I walked in, I completely forgot I was in Las Vegas. I got the chicken and waffles and they very good! Not the best I've had but it tasted homemade. Overall, a very cute family diner and a great alternative for places like Cracker Barrel.
Good place for breakfast with fair prices.

Been here a few times with my husband and we both agree the food is good, the ambiance is nice, and we enjoy a nice breakfast place. But one factor that drove us both crazy was the excessive amount of time someone came around the table and asking if we wanted more coffee. I get there can be worse service with no one coming around at all, but it felt like 3 people around the clock rotating asking if we wanted more coffee. It was a bit much. (Maybe one person can take on that task?) Overall, everyone was friendly and the food was good. We both tried the omelettes which was tasty. I had the chicken fried steak last time and it was huge! Not particularly my favorite but to each their own. We will come back....just ease up on the coffee! :)
Great food!  This is a classic diner kind of place but with a far more expansive menu. Everything is fresh, very well prepared, delicious.  Service is outstanding. You cannot go wrong here.

I wanted to like this place, but it won't last long. I felt like Gordon Ramsey picking this place a part. The decor is overwhelming, I felt like we were eating at a hoarders house. When the young lady came to seat us, she asked booth or table, I say booth. She leads us to a booth with the bench seat has a gapping hole I it covered in red duct tape. Of all the empty booths she led us to that one. I said can we have one without tape, she points to a table booth combo, and says how about a half booth? Anyways we are sitting there in our half booth half chair table, I asked for water with lemon, cuz our water sucks here in Vegas. We are handed the menu, it's a stack of yellow wrinkled, soiled, papers stapled and put on a clipboard. You have to take them off the clipboard to flip he pages so it's useless. This bothered me more than it should, go laminate them! She brings back our water and says they are freshly cutting lemon right now, instead of waiting to bring them out together. We are still looking at the menu so she said she would be back. I watched a lady walk in from outside, apparently a server just getting in for her shift. She asks if we have been helped and we said yes because we thought we had a server. It wasn't busy in there but all the other tables orders were taken but ours, finally I hear someone behind the garage sale finds asks if someone had helped us, I heard a bit of "well I asked", the server comes over and asks for our order and said "I did ask if you were helped", to which I said I thought we had but I was mistaken. Still waiting for lemons by the way. The server does what I hate, she doesn't write anything down, we order she walks away comes back asks again my part of the order cuz she forgot already. I got a salad that came in literally a teacup and saucer! The table got more salad than I did, which is sad cuz it was tasty. Next the food comes out fairly quickly, my husbands was wrong, go figure.(write it down!). I had pot roast which was really good but it does say there are peas n carrots no peas were harmed just pretty much meat and potatoes. My husband had steak and eggs when the proper hash browns came out he said it was all good. My suggestions to management, 
-clear a little bit of the decor it's too much! 
-fix the menu(are you a Mexican restaurant or a diner?) I almost left based on the menu alone.
-once you fine tune the menu get it laminated! 
-fix the broken booth seat or avoid sitting people there when there is others to use, duh!
-salad plates! You can keep the size of the salad but you try and eat lettuce out of a teacup and not look like a slob, it's embarrassing. 
-OHHHH, and a big one, stop interrupting customers every minute to ask if everything is ok! We were asked by 4 different people at least 4 times each of we were "ok?", that's about 16 times! It was ridiculous.

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!

My office is in the area and it always seems like there aren't many lunch options. A couple of friends raved about it, so I went. And I went again the day after because I loved it that much.

I won't go into the details of the decor but it is awesome, fun and feels like a piece of warm Americana is in front of you.

I recommend the chicken fried chicken. Our server Jacky made the suggestion. It was so good! I didn't care for vegetables so when I went the day after, I got the breakfast version which includes eggs and hash browns.

You should know that portions are generous and come hungry!

All around, it's my new favorite spot!

The Lemon & Capers White Fish dish served today was cooked perfectly & would compete with any of the High End Restaurants.

My husband & I have been to Home Town Eats several times, and the food is consistently outstanding.

I'm a big breakfast eater, I travel for my job all over the United States and seek out places just like this. A friendly staff with the owners working right in the restaurant truly a home-town place. They specialize in homemade chicken fried steak and put simply it's the very best that I have ever had. Truly can't wait to get back to Vegas so I can eat here again.

Wow...

This place is going downhill fast.

I met with a potential new boss here for breakfast, he said he would pay and I wanted to make a good impression so I let this slide but I ordered a steak and eggs, medium well and it came medium rare and super tough...The portion sizes have shrunk and when I asked for butter, oh were out of that...ok so Id like a root beer, were out of that, a pepsi, were out of that...OK

I heard the man behind me order corned beef hash, oh Yup you gussed it and when I asked for a to go cup for my coke, YUP.    

Did an order not come in?
Are they running out of business?
Do they need a new chef?   Yes.     

He seemed happy with his meal though he did say that it wasnt very hot.   

:/    Not sure I would go back or not.

Im a sucker for comfort food made in house from scratch and Hometown Classic American Eats is that!  Their humble beginnings started in downtown Henderson. They are located in a larger place now!!  Corner of Pecos and Russell Rd. Plenty of parking and easier access than the former location. 

Got a quick glance of the menu that lists dishes for breakfast lunch and dinner! Yes! Now open for dinner too! 

My focus was on breakfast since it was early in the day. So I chose a brisket hash,Southwestern style! It's tossed with potatoes and grilled peppers and onions and their own signature chipotle sauce. A cool twist to this breakfast hash. It was good but just a tad spicy for me.  The brisket was really tender!  I should note it's listed as Southwestern "Briscuit" Hash and described as beef briscuit.  I guess that is a phonetically plausible way to spell brisket ;) 

Everything here exudes a warm homey feel and country charm! I love the upholstery prints of the booths. The dining area is pretty bright, airy,clean and everything is brand spanking new. They had several large tv screens throughout the place. Had to do an eyeroll to that two star reviewer who has problems with them playing news stations.  If something simple as TV programming offends you, y'all got some issues,,lol

The menus are on copy paper and on clipboards.

You will find a large chalkboard adorned with cute drawings from their artistic young customers. It has the Daily Blue Plate special and Soup Of The Day listed. There's also a chalkboard stand that had Happy Hour specials. 3-5pm? 1/2 off appetizers.

Service was great! There were several tables occupied early AM. The  host/server took the time to acknowledge us and we were seated pretty quickly. Our orders were taken and came out promptly also. No complaints of cold, or lukewarm food from us. Our dishes were steaming, plates were hot. Our drinks refilled without having to ask. As we got up to leave, staff acknowledge us again.  Couldnt ask for a more perfect first visit. 

There's salisbury steak smothered in mushroom sauce and homemade pies I saw on their @HometownEats IG account looks soo good!  So you know we'll be back sooner than later.
Stopped by for breakfast. Had the chicken fried steak. It was excellent. Very impressed with the quality of food as well as the price and portion. I'll be back for more.

We have been eating here almost every weekend since they were located on Lake Mead in Henderson. The food is great, and the owners and staff are very friendly and make us feel like family. Everything I have tried has been delicious, from the bacon and eggs to the salmon.

The food here is actually good even above average. So I contemplated writing this review for a couple months now. I was really contemplating if it was important for the community to know about my experience or if the  restaurant needed to be made aware of their neglectful service. I figured it is important and I would like to know if anyone has had the same experience. 

On my second visit to this establishment. I was accompanied by my 4 year old son and we arrived around brunch. We were not dressed elegant as this is a pretty casual place. There was a lady who made eye contact with me from the kitchen but did not say hello. There was also young lady and maybe one or two young men catering to a reasonable sized crowd. Yet they still looked pressured to be hastefully serving the relatively average crowd. There was a couple already there when we arrived and as we were waiting they were pulled to their Seats, still no acknowledgment for us though. Soon enough another couple comes in they sit down for 2-3 mins and the young lady greets them and asks how many... Still not a greeting or even awkward eye contact for us...  That couple who came in after us was even seated and we were never agknowledged so we left.I thought for sure the couple would agknowledge us , but no. Idk what the people were thinking that day,  but on a previous occasion when I visited with my husband I received very different treatment. You can come to your own conclusions. I don't plan to return to this unwelcoming environment.

This restaurant is excellent!  The service and the food top notch!
The atmosphere is comfortable , the music is fun and every dish we ordered ( three of us) came out cooked exactly as we ordered it!!
If you want the best breakfast in Vegas then go to hometown eats diner!!
Just had their Chorizo Skillet! It was amazing! I'm a pretty big guy and I still was more than satisfied with the serving size! I finished my delicious pancakes and the service was amazing!

So I had just dropped off my car to get it fixed and after an hour of driving around with the boyfriend, we ended up here for brunch. We were excited because we really wanted an authentic "american" breakfast lol When we had seen that there was chicken and waffles on the menu, I died a little from excitement. Also, the boyfriend's fave - corned beef hash or whatever- was also on the menu. We had also ordered two large orange juices...first of all, for $4 a glass (it didnt even seem much larger than their normal cups), the orange juice didnt even taste fresh. It seemed like it was some bottle orange juice from the store - like Sunny D or another brand. Because of this, I was already annoyed that we were already down almost $10 for NON fresh orange juice ugh My bf had ordered soup and they had forgot so they gave it to us with the other food. He was going to cancel the order but of course, right when hes about to tell them, they bring it out. When I got my chicken and waffles, I was SO disappointed T.T It was literally a GIANT chicken finger and a waffle. It came with country gravy that had no taste either. (I had almost asked for ranch to eat my giant chicken finger with instead) The corned beef hash my boyfriend had also gotten was not very tasty as well. It was not put together well and some of the potatoes werent cooked all the way. OH! I also asked for egg whites only  (she repeated our order like 2-3x before she walked away just so you know) and of course, the eggs didnt come out right. It was just disappointment after disappointment. We didnt finish our meals needless to say. And then after all this, our stomachs werent happy with us either all day! We are never going to come back here again.

What a nice place... the food and staff was great...
Breakfast was good, can't wait til I can come back for lunch..

Stopped by today at around 9:30 a.m, the place wasn't overly crowded so we thought we'd picked the perfect time. 
When we arrived we seated ourselves and waited for our server to stop by, we noticed that there were three servers and a busboy/lady. After being walked past several times a server stopped by our table with a menu and then told us our server would be right over. Well, many more minutes passed and the same server came back with water and took our drink order and told us our server would be right over. So, again after several minutes another server came over to take our food order. We were set on breakfast and were actually interested in trying their famous hash browns but was informed that they did not have them today!
The food came out pretty quickly and was actually very tasty although the toast came out dry and we had to ask twice to get some butter for it. The servers were actually nice but just so incredibly slow and disorganised that it ruined our whole experience, as did the fact there didn't appear to be any air conditioning in the place. 
After what felt like an eternity we asked for our check and went up front to pay, where we had to wait for someone to take our money, we could have skipped out on the bill and nobody would have known!
We don't know if this was just an off day but I don't know if we'll come back to find out. 


So nice to get a reply about our experience, it really shows a level of caring, thank you!

Great place to eat! Great homey food, great recipes and good service. It's nice to see a nice little restaurant take time to ensure a great experience. Hurry up and experience this place before the secret is out!

Great home cooked meals!  Everything was good,  hot and my family was very satisfied.  When kids want to go back,  you know you've found a winner! A tad pricey but we get it.  We will probably be back because it was good and service was also.  Our server was friendly and fast
Great job!

We stumbled on this place when we were looking for a good breakfast. The service was good, very friendly. The restrooms were clean. We gave 4 stars because the food was good, just not excellent. The Eggs Benedict was very good. The eggs were poached perfectly. My husband had the Chorizo skillet and it was fine.

I was craving breakfast so bad and this place is the perfect spot for it. Situated between pecos and Russell, the seating area had an open concept with Windows stretching all the way around you can see the passing cars pass by and figure out what plans you have ahead of the days in front of you. They have oldies music playing and it's very relaxing.

The menus are bright yellow and easy to read and the inside of this place feels like a southern home vacation. Carla was our waitress and she took care of us (very nice gal)! 

I ordered the chicken fried chicken with 2 eggs and my partner ordered the NY steak and eggs. DEL-ISH! This is the first time a restaurant didn't get chicken fried steak mixed up lol. The home potatoes has the right amount of spice adding the green peppers and the chicken batter I can already tell tasted home made. The NY steak was cooked just the way she liked it and the toast had just the right amount of butter in it. 

I will def come back to eat more breakfast here!

The food is sooooo good and the portions are amazing. I've never had a bad meal here! The staff is friendly and pleasant. It's usually just a couple guys that work there and you can tell they busy their butts! I've met the owner a couple times and it's refreshing to see an owner check to see if you're enjoying your meal. 
The only thing I would look into would be maybe lessening the menu because it can be overwhelming and maybe laminating them. They are currently just pieces of paper on a clipboard and they get gross really quick. Other than that the place is better than blueberry hill, dennys and IHOP all together. A real diner gem in Vegas !

I live around the corner from Hometown eats and have been coming here since it opened. The food is always fresh, generous portions, lots of menu items, great staff, privately owned, tvs, always play oldies in the background. The owner is always making improvements and she is passionate about making the customer experience the best possible. When i see a review of 2 stars because the menu was on sheets of paper on a clipboard it saddens me to think someone could be so petty. The menus were just changed and she is currently working on a menu style you see in most restaurants. Thank you Hometown eats for being around the corner from my home. Always enjoy the food and the friendly service. Chicken fried chicken is my favorite with home made hash browns. Yummmm

I was pleasantly surprised with our visit today. I wasn't expecting much since it has changed hands a few times in the past years. But, I must say, the food was very good. I normally don't eat French fries, but they are fabulous!  My son had breakfast for lunch, and now, I can't wait to go back for breakfast!  He had scrambled eggs with ham and potatoes and a biscuit.

I stopped in for breakfast on a Saturday at 11:20 AM.  The restaurant is big for a family style place, with a lot of natural light.  It looked clean and well maintained. 
The place was on the emptier side so I expected fast service and that expectation was met.  I had an omelet with hash browns and toast and my daughter had the chocolate chip pancakes with bacon and sausage.  I also ordered coffee.  The regular menu included breakfast potatoes, but I prefer pancakes or hash browns.  They had no problem making the substitute. Our bill was $22.00.
My coffee was hot and fresh and both of our meals were very good.  The server was friendly and the bathroom was clean.  I will return here again.

A neighborhood treasure! The biscuits (and I'm a southern boy) are equal to my Grandmothers. The Chicken fried steak or chicken has a wonderful, almost, tempura breading and the breakfast sandwich for a quick morning breakfast...OH Ask for the special deep fried potatoes: I've never had anything like them, reminds me of the onions one uses on top of Thanksgiving's String beans. But the warmth and neighborly staff and owners are reason enough to go.

Hair in sourdough bread. We told them to take it back and they got us new toast. Then the lady with blue hair came over and interrupted our phone call saying that "nobody has time for that". This place was very bad business. There was no manager present to assist us. The place is a joke. Bacon was under cooked as well and pretty much raw. Forget this place and this lady took forever to get my check

First time coming tonight and I thought it wouldn't be that good since there was no one in the parking lot, but I tried it anyways and it was amazing! I got my cheeseburger and fries for $7 and it was delicious. I would only say that the drinks are a little pricey at $2.50 but it's okay

Cute little dinner, that serves decent breakfast stuff at a reasonable price. Upon arriving at 8am on a Saturday, we were seated right away. The decor of this establishment, reminds me of a granny's house in the county- super retro! The bus boy came over to bring us our beverages, from there our server Cheryl came by to take our order. After she took our order, the food came out from the open faced kitchen after about 15 minutes. Everything looked good, as far as taste good- it was just okay. 
I ordered the brisket hash, and it was actually too salty for my liking- so I asked for a small serving of sour cream. Come to find out, Cheryl ended up charging me for the small side of sour cream. Say what? I like to be informed if I'm going to charged- instead of being under the impression, it's free.
Happy to have this little gem in our neighborhood! The Chix fried steak and eggs was off the charts!  Can't wait to try it for dinner!

This place is unfortunately very disappointing.  The decore and atmosphere promise a nice hometown diner, but the food is bland and overpriced for what you receive, they are stingy with the food and toppings. The staff is very friendly and engaging but I can't give anything with such bad food more than one star. I mean how do you make bacon taste bad, BACON!! Should have been a tip off that it was nearly empty on a Saturday morning.

Really outstanding food and service. I had the fish and chips, huge portions, thin breading ,great fries. Great value for the price. My wife had the pulled pork BBQ sandwich, also outstanding and more than she could eat. Great place for lunch, going to try breakfast next.

My wife and I ate there for the first time tonight. INCREDIBLE!!!! We loved it and will go back. I had the BBQ bacon cheeseburger with fries and my wife had the french dip. The fries are exactly like In-N-Out (FABULOUS). Both meals were filling and very very good. I was able to taste everything on my burger, yes even the bacon and cheese. They even make there own ranch dressing. The name says it all. It has a very homey feeling when you go in. Even with the yummy chicken fajita appetizer and 2 drinks our bill was still under $32. We talked to one of the owners who told us they used to be in Henderson on Water street and Lake Mead for 4 years before coming to there current location on the corner of Pecos and Russell. They have been there for 2 months. I hope they stay since it hasn't been a friendly location for past establishments. Good luck to you Hometown Eats, we will see you again and tell all our friends about this place.
Good comfort food. Had the meatloaf. Second choice would have been the turkey dinner.

Been to Hometown Eats many times. Glad it's in walking distance. Recommend it to everyone that enjoys a wide variety of home cooked food. Feels good being greeted at the door like you are family. Always a great meal at reasonable prices. Wish they had longer evening hours though.

Thursday mid morning, very pleasant atmosphere, close to airport.
Nice service. Old fashioned music, still pleasant though.
Food okay. Typical eggs combo. Good eggs! Their home fries good not great but not bad either.
Side biscuit & gravy again just ok.
Chicken Caesar salad & dressing nothing spectacular.
Great food.   Worth the wait. Waitress Jacky was great.  Might want to consider adding  additional waitstaff during busy lunch hours

Ate here for a late breakfast/early lunch on a Saturday at 11 am. Great time to go as the place was pretty quiet. There was a group of 7 of us and they had no problems with us wanting separate checks.
The service was good, no issues to report. The waiter checked on us several times and refilled our glasses/cups without having to ask.
The food was yummy and the portions were perfect. I don't think anyone in the group had any complaints. I had the chicken fried chicken and waffles. The waffles were perfect with powder sugar and butter. The chicken was a boneless chicken breast so it was easy to cut and pair with the waffles. The breading on the chicken was light and crispy. 
Prices were reasonable. I will be back for sure. The menu is huge so there are a lot of options to try.
I decided to visit this place! I liked the decor, I ordered to go order.  Egg, 3-basin, and hash browns..$6. Was good, and tasty!  Prices are amazing!
Clean friendly service......waitstaff was awesome food was good.....place was really clean. Decorations were fun and amusing

Super breakfast joint with great food and awesome service. Had a rental car and was less than 10 minutes from airport when returning car. Left an hour early and was in and out in little more than 35-40 mins. The chicken fried chicken with country gravy was awesome but portions were so huge I couldn't finish it all (hardly a negative). If I had one thing to complain about it would be that I wish they had strawberry jam on the tables (but perhaps I just had to ask... like I said, no biggie). Overall great place and put a smile on our faces to start the day.
Love to come to Hometown Eats! . It's decorated like an old school Grandma's kitchen. Comfy decor!! Polite staff & multiple menu options. We've always had a positive experience.

I had gone to this place when it was located in downtown Henderson a number of time. The food was always great. Recently it relocated to the intersection of Pecos and Russell in S.E. Las Vegas and it's very close to me, so I get to go there more often. Keep in mind that this is not a high class, bistro type restaurant, it is a classic, comfort food style diner. The prices are reasonable and as I mentioned the menu is basically old time classic comfort foods, of course, there are a few modern day selections as well. The daily Blue Plate Specials are a no brainer selection, if it's something you like. Cheap, really good and a nice portion of food. I love this place for what it is, a very casual place, with great comfort food selections.

just got done eating an outstanding club sandwich with the best potato salad I have ever had. we enjoyed their food for years at their old location and the  combination of great food,service and a clean, comfortable ambiance here at Pecos and Russell is outstanding!

The eats were great! I had a waffle with chicken and a side of white gravy.
The chicken was a pounded chicken breast with a flour drenching. I enjoyed it greatly. My friends portions were large and tasteful. Prices are below the competition. Service was great!

Wow!!
I found this nice breakfast cafe 2 years ago and excellent food!  l am from the Midwest and us Chicago people like great food and clean bathroom.
The breakfast pancakes and crispy bacon is my favorite. I bring all my and friends there from out of town and enjoy! My family like everything on menu! Keep up the great work!
Very fresh, good food. Service is great, friendly and fast. I like interior inside, very cute, cozy family running business. Highly recommend everyone to give a try to this place.

This place is great! A very homey feeling when you walk in! Very cute decorations and the music is awesome!!!
Our waitress was Karla, who was very courteous and made sure we had everything we needed checking on us multiple times and making small talk.  
It so great to see a small business get larger and do better! 
Well worth the drive and the food ! 
Biscuits and gravy are to die for !!!

Super cute diner with such amazing staff! Today I ordered the turkey club on sourdough, and it was so delicious! Fresh carved turkey with fresh ham how can you go wrong. It was so good Im still thinking about it and planning my next visit! Thanks guys I will be back next week

Almost 3 years ago I ate here at their original location in downtown Henderson and had an absolutely terrible experience. I was in the area and thought I would give it another chance. The restaurant itself is beautiful! Service was excellent, Chris is an excellent server and I hope that they keep him happy and keep him on board. it was also great to see ladies running the kitchen! I I'm happy to see improvement and I hope for continued success for this restaurant. I also like that they don't refer to their smaller plate menu as a senior or a kid menu and that they welcome anyone of all ages to order off that menu! there are definitely some things I want to come back and try.
Such a great deal!! The breakfast specials are amazing. I can't believe the amount of food for the price. This place is the best kept secret right now. You will not be disappointed.

Let's start by saying, I eat out too much. I like most places, but Hometown Eats off Pecos is simply amazing. I've passed by a 100 times going to another favorite place. I finally stopped by and as soon as I opened the door,  I knew I found a gem. THIS PLACE IS GREAT, SERIOUSLY. The smells are wonderful and the customer service is most excellent. You gotta look at the menu now. Ally, the owner, is a secret agent of nicety and caring. She loves, us, her food , and the restaurant. I got the Ultimate Combo, with 3 eggs, all 3 meats, toast and homestyle potatoes for $12, that's 1990 prices. I will be coming back. Thanks Ally for being so kind-loving and being here for those of us who loves homestyle cooking and a friendly atmosphere. I loved it all.

Service was quick. In a party of 3, 2 of us were satisfied with our food, the third had just one complaint, waffle in chicken and waffles was not crispy. Other than that, great place, will be back again.

I got the chicken fried steak and it was okay. I honestly wasn't too impressed with it. It was really light. But what I wasn't too happy with was the gravy. The gravy makes the food but it wasn't that good. Potatoes weren't that great to be honest. Kind of bland and I didn't like the texture that much. Also my boyfriend and friend got biscuits with theirs and were told that the biscuits came with gravy on them but when they got it, there was no gravy on either. They messed up my eggs because I ordered scrambled but they gave me over easy. Instead of just grabbing a side of scrambled, they took my whole plate back so my boyfriend and friend had to wait to eat. I'll probably try this place again just because I always give places a second chance but I wasn't that impressed.

What can I say, except amazing!!!! Very friendly and inviting!!!!!! Staff was on point and at our table anticipating our every need!!!!! Chicken fingers to die for, French dip was outstanding and BBQ pizza well done was great sweet but savory with fresh cilantro!!!! They also have 2 pages of breakfast that looks fantastic!!!!! Can't wait to go back tomorrow!!!
This place is a nice little hole in the wall come here a few times with friends and have been pleased...

Well here we go again!  This place was horrible when it was on Lake Mead....and it's just as horrible on Pecos!  Must be the same owner unfortunately.  Don't waste your time or money.  Food was terrible!  Cold....no flavor.....dry.....and really small portions.....which didn't really matter because you couldn't stomach it anyway!  Fast food blows this dump away!  Yuck!  People just don't know what decent food is anymore!  We'll never go back here again.  And 3 other people that were walking out said the same thing!

BEST restaurant for families to eat some traditional American breakfast! Plenty of tables inside for large parties. Service is very quick and attentive. All staff is very friendly. Food is great and an amazing value! Eggs Benedict and French toast are some of the best dishes. The sausages are fresh and have a nice kick! Definitely coming back soon.

Not a bad little place off the beaten path. I found it on restaurant.com where I purchased a voucher for 5 off a purchase of 10 or more. I came in for lunch though I was very tempted to order breakfast food. Instead I opted for a bacon cheeseburger.  My waiter was very friendly and personable.  He checked on me often to make sure I had what ever I needed. My food was great and the price was even better. My meal came to 11 and some change not to head for the quality of food.  It's even better that I got to use my voucher for 5 more off.  The only knock is that I asked for a iced tea after he brought my food out but he forgot to bring it to me. He was very apologetic. I will come back to Troy some of the breakage menu items in the near future.

The next time you make your way to Las Vegas, you might want to consider Hometown. Three of us for early breakfast and late lunch. A bit of what I would call a greasy spoon, but I thought overall really good. 

First, a bit on their service. Honestly, it was fantastic. "C" and I ordered iced tea. The Aussie ordered water. Refills were plentiful. For those that know me, I never wanted for a refill. They were managing our table with at least four individuals, including the manager. 

We ordered an omelet, a breakfast skillet and I had the NY Strip and eggs. Mine was good, although my steak was over cooked. I asked for my usual "very rare" and it was probably medium. But, it was tasty. Tasty enough I didn't send it back. Steak was. It a top shelf cut by any means (it was $13 for the entree) but had good flavor and reasonably tender. And for me to be ok with it medium it had to be decent. I am also trying to avoid wheat. Although I would have loved a biscuit, i asked for other options and our waitperson quickly offered sliced tomatoes. Perfect. Most places just say sorry when you want something else other than bread. 

C's skillet had chorizo and eggs. One weird thing is they put chunks of potato in the skillet, and then give you hash browns as well. A bit too much potato for her.  But, they also gave her a green and red salsa. She liked them so much that although the skillet was gone, she wanted to take the left over salsa back with her. They were both good

Lastly M had his omelet. He liked it and scarfed it down pretty quick. He asked for hash browns, but only had a few as he was trying to be good on his low carb diet. But, the manager saw this and pushed to get him something else, and offered him green beans with carrots a few times (very nicely). He finally got them as well and between C and M they both liked the vegetables. Very attentive of the manager to see this. 

Overall, I would go back. Heck, may be back this trip. I'll try next time to tell them they over cooked   my steak and really tell them I mean very rare - like 20 - 30 seconds a side. Otherwise our bill was $42.48 and left $8 gratuity. Very reasonable for the three of us walking out quite full. I would recommend!  And, check in with Yelp for 10% off your check.

Their food is delicious! The environment is so welcoming. However, the many times we have come, their timely service could be so much faster. The food takes a good 25-30 minutes after ordering to be served. They are all very nice but extremely slow and it's very frustrating!

Just had breakfast here and it was amazing! Not only are the workers super nice, the food is amazing and the atmosphere is super cute! We asked about the chili and they offered us a sample (the chili was great and had a slight kick to it). The clam chowder, southwestern brisket hash, and the pulled pork hash were all so good! Also, if you check in on yelp, you get 10% off! It's family owned and everything about this place is splendid I wish I found this place earlier so I could've came here more often the past 4 years! Too bad I'm moving back home now ): but will definitely come back when I visit Vegas again!!!
Great customer service, very personable! I had the chicken tenders (AMAZING!!). Thank you guys!!

The food was good and the atmosphere was nice but the service was horrid. There were many staff members but they were all busy focusing on a large group that, in the hour-ish we were there, never showed up. The menu provided here on line is outdated and incorrect on prices - especially when we payed $10.25 for the biscuits and gravy and in here it's marked as $6.99. Don't believe me, check the prices on here against our receipt... they don't match.

We don't live very far from your new restaurant and have been there both for breakfast and lunch. The first few times for breakfast was good. Then my husband went there a couple times and service was awful and hamburger was dry and in his words, "it's like eating a piece of carboard". We figure, maybe the cook and server is new or having a bad day and will give them another few chances. Unfortunately out of the six times we have been there, only two times did we like it. The service is consistently bad and food not that great. I'm sorry to say we won't be returning to your restaurant. We were really hoping on having a great neighborhood restaurant in our area. I wish you the best of luck.

After seeing several businesses come and go for this location, I decided to wait a bit before giving this place a shot. After seeing several weeks with a steady flow of cars, today was the day to try them! Walking in, the place is much bigger than I expected and it had a super cozy and fresh vibe with all the decorations and large windows. All of the employees were also really nice and friendly.
Our waters took pretty long to get, basically came when our food came out (around 20-25 minutes) but our server apologized and had a friendly attitude about it so no problem! 

Chicken Fried Steak $9.50: Anytime I try a new place and they have Chicken Fried Steak on the menu, that's usually what I go for lol This one was pretty solid. Came with Sourdough toast (my choice), potatoes, and scrambled eggs. Potatoes could use more flavor, eggs were perfect, sauce was bomb, and the actual fried steak was seasoned good but the breading didn't stick and was sliding right off! Wah! No biggie though, I would still order it again. I still have Rise & Shine and Hard Rock's Mr. Lucky's 24/7 cafe as my leading contenders for the Chicken Fried Steak lol.

Southwestern Brisket Sandwich $9.50: The boyfriend had this one and of course I tasted it lol pretty good as well. The side it normal comes with is I believe french fries or potato salad but my boyfriend is a little weird and requested hashbrowns instead lol Our server asked if he wanted them extra crispy, he said sure. They came out kind of weird lol pretty dry but tasted like straight potato chips lol he'll probably settle for regular hashbrowns next time. Brisket was tender, soft, flavorful and had a good amount of sauce, wasn't dry at all.

One thing that stood out to me was that most of the time these diner-esque places use bad oil and I can taste it pretty heavily in the food. However, the food at this place wasn't even really oily and there was no oil taste at all! Bonus points lol

Overall, I'm not exactly a "fan" yet but everything was yummy, the location is super close to me, the ambiance is really neat, and I'll definitely be back mostly for breakfast. Oh and maybe their burgers, one of the tables near us got several burgers and they all looked pretty good :)
This place is amazing!! Perfect combination of excellent food and customer service!! I love the music and style of the place.

Do yourself a favor and just go ! We went because of Yelp and it did not disappoint ! 
I wanted a home  style type meal after working for almost a week in Vegas I just needed something other then shrimp and prime rib . 

On the suggestion of our waiter because I was torn between two things I got the Salisbury steak it came with a small soup  or salad , veggie of the day and mash . After talking with the wonderful Humburto I chose the chicken and rice soup . I asked him if they made it there and indeed they do . 
Salad dressing was homemade , gravy was homemade ..... Go I am telling you it's good stuff

This gem in the Southeast part of town hits the mark. The coffee was good and the meal was good. We went while at work so the guys go the chicken and waffle, I got the pancakes, and eggs and bacon. I asked what they are known for and was told their chicken friend chicken, so when I asked for it she said they only had one piece of chicken left.. You're known for your chicken but you don't have any.. Talk about lack of prep. I will come here again to try the chicken fried chicken.

We tried!!!  We really want to love this place.  Let's start from the beginning.  We tried this place for breakfast and the food is good.  The service was not that great.  They were busy and I get it, so we tried again for breakfast and the same!  Service was slowwwww.  Again, they were busy.  So we then phone ordered off of the yelp menu.  I did the math, ordered breakfast for me and my hubby.  I figured maybe phone ordering will be quick in and out.  So I send the hubby and he comes back with no change???  So I rechecked the prices from yelp and it should've been no more that $15.  So I call and spoke with a lady, very nice lady who tells me that the prices they have on Yelp were from 5 years ago and they hadn't updated it yet.  So I can was pissed!  She apologized and was nice but no discount for future orders or anything.  Ughhh  ok, again we tried TONIGHT for dinner.  And this place had potential, the food is great!!!  BUT, tonight... I ask for a iced tea but the waiter tells me their is no iced tea, something was broken or I don't know?  Ok so I just say apple juice.  So we are ready to order and hubby wants a grilled ham and cheese, to our surprise the waiter says they have no ham!!  Damn!!!  So I guess its hit and miss here   I thought maybe we would get a discount since there was no tea or HAM?  Nope!!!  Plus damn glass of apple juice was $4.75??  I could have bought 2 gallons for that price!!!  I think tonight was our last time, and what a shame because we love the food but service sucks.

I went in with my little bro around 3 for a late lunch. I ordered a tuna melt, because I thought it was hard to mess up. Oh I was wrong, a tuna MELT implies it's a hot sandwich or at least the cheese would be melted, I got neither. My bro got the chicken fried chicken. They can cook a big chicken finger, good job. The neon yellow eggs he got looked and tasted terrible. The potatoes did look like from scratch but had no flavor. When I left the cashier/waiter asked me "How was everything?" I responded, " Not impressed." Then he replied "business is business, can't make everyone happy." That's the reason I'm writing this review. If you like cafeteria food go here, but Kaitlin's diner down on trop is ten times better, and black bear diner on sunset, is a close second.

I love this place!!! Excellent food n Customer Service!!! Me n My Husband shared the Blueberry Pancakes, Sausage, and we added the home fries! The Home Fries were Delicious just like you would make at home! Not to Mention Reasonably Priced!!! I'll Definitely be Back!!!

I have a soft spot for diners. Maybe because they remind me of being a kid and dining with my family. Maybe it's because the food is usually greasy and loaded with carbs. All of which I have an addiction for.

What you need to know: 

The milkshakes are made with Thrifty ice cream. 
The biscuits are made from scratch.
They serve an open faced hot turkey Thanksgiving style sandwich with white bread soaking up all of the goodness.

I have had the chicken fried steak and enjoyed the crispiness of the steak along with the biscuit and peppery brown gravy. I've also had the grilled cheese on rye which isn't ground breaking in itself, but it was exactly what I like. I have tasted the turkey sandwich mentioned above, but thought the gravy needed some work.

The staff and owner are friendly and accommodating to allergies and preferences. The pricing is also reasonable with lunch specials during the week. 

Sometimes I crave a fatty meal or just some home cooking and that is what they are serving hot on a platter at Hometown.

This place was hands down the best breakfast experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Service was great, but the food..the food was phenomenal. My dad and I split the chicken fried steak and and pulled pork breakfast and both meals were incredible. The place is so cute and feels like home. 10/10 would recommend to a friend.

I love this place!! We come here all the time... All the times I've been I've never had a bad experience! And never tried anything on the menu I haven't liked! I am so glad they moved in! Can't wait to try more from the menu! The French dip is amazing! Had chili cheese dog today and it was amazing!! Steak and eggs is awesome!

I had the eggs benedicts (no spinach) and it was delicious. The Canadian bacon was perfectly sized and grilled and the hollandaise sauce was the best I ever had. And most importantly the english muffin was perfectly grilled (not soggy like so many other places serve!) I also had a side of bacon and again it was perfectIy cooked with a great crisp to it. The service was a bit slow but we could clearly see the employees were not goofing off and they were all working hard and helping each other out. I look forward to trying more items on the menu especially the beef stroganoff on their dinner menu YUM!

I was in Vegas on a 4 hour layover, which gave me, Mimi, and Aunt T enough time to grab some breakfast, gab a little bit before I hopped back on the plane. Despite being locals, Mimi and T actually had not been to Hometown, but thanks to Yelp, we found a new breakfast place to frequent! It was not busy on the Saturday morning we came. The eclectic decor lives up to the "hometown" part of the name and made it feel a bit home-y.

We were given clipboards with pages to thumb through for menus, which was a little odd but fine. My aunt's menu was missing a page but she at least could peek off the others. We all ordered our fair share of breakfast food -- veggie omelette for me, pick-your-own egg meals for the others. The food arrived warm and prompt, and it was delicious! My aunt and I were pleased with our choices of the hometown style potatoes, which included peppers and kick of spice mixed in. My omelette was great; plenty of veggies on the inside nor was it runny! 

The waitress kept the coffee flowing, even after we ate, paid, and continued to chat for a little while. Perfect for me since I had been up since 4:30AM! Hometown Eats provided a lovely little meal on a Saturday morning, and I look forward to future breakfasts here!
What a treat. Everything to like about a clean, super cute diner. Move over cracker barell, this place gives good classic meals and you won't lose your spouse in the gift store!
Great food! Reasonable prices. Very cozy environment. The chicken fried steak and eggs Beni are delicious! 10$ bottomless mimosas to top it off! I highly recommend
Cute place....servers were nice.  They gave a good amount of food for the price. Good was also good. A place I would come back to eat...

This was a last minute option and I do not regret it at all! We dropped by late Saturday morning and it wasn't too busy. We were seated promptly and our waitress was friendly, prompt, and overall great. She checked on us various times and the coffee kept coming! The food was delicious. Eggs over easy were perfect and the bacon was crispy. Get the old fashioned pancakes! Best pancakes ever. Only miss was that their famous hash browns were not available and their wheat toast was a little stale but overall great and will return.
sat morn 9-19-15 terrible experience bad service bad food dirty table dirty bathroom tables unbussed what a disaste this place wont be around much longer i guarantee

Try the chicken fried steak! It's delicious. Everything here is homemade. I love the feeling I get when I eat homemade biscuits and gravy. This had me back at Grandma's table, eating the good stuff. 
The staff here is very nice, and went out of their way to make sure my son had his questions answered about the menu items. He ordered the two egg breakfast, with bacon and hash browns. They tell him that all hash browns and bacon are cooked to order, so please give them ten minutes. True to their word, ten minutes our food was delivered and it was piping hot and delicious. The bacon was crisp and fresh. My biggest pet peeve is when you order crispy bacon and they deep fry it. This bacon was cooked on the flat grill, and it came out exactly how he wanted it. 
The atmosphere is that of a home style dinner. It's very comfortable. Nice to get away from the chain restaurants and go to a family owned dinner that really has great food. The food was so good, I ordered chicken strips to go. They were hand breaded and came with homemade ranch. They were excellent. 
I will definitely come back, as the menu has so many options and I want to try them all!

Gran momma is that you??????  Well happy to say that it is.... opening the door, the sense of granma's home is all around, from the eclectic decor to even items on the menu.... peeps i have a new breakfast spot...... gran momma treated me well so i will go to again... Remember.... its all about the food.   That was good... owner stops by the table and was very endearing, gave the family background... midwest husband(Indiana) mother makes the sauces and apparently as in all families the wife takes the money.....lol...
This place is very nice  and the staff is very friendly as well.They were on top of the refills and the Denver omelette was amazing.I will definitely be back and will recommend this place to friends

I am glad to have found another breakfast place that's worth going to,  this place has your typical American dishes,  it is well decorated, spacious and very clean, music in the background is great.  The eggs  Benedict one of the best I've tried.

This has been many failed restaurants over the years and hoped this one would be different due to it's proximity to my office.

The food is always good. The service started slow but has improved. David is far and away the best server in this place.

But.......The kitchen turnaround time is absolutely awful and getting worse every time. One day they were busy so knew they would be slow but we were there for more than an hour. Several patrons left before us. The last time (the other day) there were no more than 6 tables and we were still there for an hour. I only get an hour for lunch so this is not acceptable, especially for dishes that are not that complicated.

Apparently, they also sell cake and desert but none of the staff, owners included, have ever notified me of this.

I've given them about 10 opportunities and have expressed my concerns each time. Sadly, I'm done. Too many other restaurants in the area that understand lunch. This is not a fine dining venue.

Sorry, I did try.

First (and last) time there was on Thursday, June 11, 2015. I was treated to lunch by a client who suggested the place because it had just newly reopened under new management (yet again) We were seated immediately, but it took forever for the waiter to arrive and take our drink orders the menus were on printer paper attached to a clipboard. In my opinion; the service was slow, food mediocre. I have no idea what the check was because I didn't pay the bill. Even if I was allowed to eat there for free -- I would go elsewhere. My opinion for what it's worth -- STAY AWAY!
Definitely will be supporting this place! Prices are decent and the food has this home cooking feel to it.

This is my second time eating at Hometown Eats. The first time was good. Food was ok and the service was excellent.  In this visit however,  it took over 45 minutes to get our food.  I cut in to my eggs and got ready to take a bite and there was a long hair cooked in my egg. As discussing as this is,  I know this sort of thing happens. We informed the hostess at the reguster but all she did is say that they wouldn't charge us for the iced tea we drank before getting our meal.  Not that I would have accepted but I thought they would at least offer to re-make our food and maybe offer some sort of discount.  Nope, she just said I don't know how this happened,  we all wear nets.

We came here today and it was pretty good just not great. It was very classic and that's cool, our server was good too. Just doesn't have anything fancy which is fine but if creative is what your looking for you won't find it here. Some people like that more anyways

3rd review.  I loved this place, then I hated it.  Now I'm giving it another try.

Back to 4 stars.  Service and food were exceptional.  

Thanks to the proprietor for not giving up on the business and getting this place in shape.

Cute place.  Burger dry dry dry.  Fries luke warm  omelette big.  Potatoes, well they are basic breakfast potatoes.   Not that busy for prime time saturday 1030am.  Could see the stress on the faces of ALL staff including the kitchen.. oh boy seemed unorganized.   People lined up to be seated (2/3rd of restaurant open tables) and no n one available to seat them.  4 stars on decor.  2 star on service 3 star on food (average food reasonable  pricing for what it is) never got one refill offered on soda.  Had to ask for check.

There is a reason for this three star review.

First off, I came across this gem when stopping by the nearby Sprint Store. I fell in love with the outside appearance of Hometown Eats since it looked like a very cute, friendly restaurant.
