My fiance and I were talking about how we wished there was a restaurant we could go to monthly, and I even saw ourselves dining there in the far future as 65-year-olds.

We would go there whenever we had the time together (college students, full time work, and fiance is in the military). However, about twice already whenever we would go to the restaurant after work, class, and what not -- the place would be closed and we would have to eat somewhere else more or less satisfying. I'd look at the hours beforehand, but it differed from the hours once we got to the place.

I love the restaurant: the food, atmosphere, staff, decorations, and everything else is just so great. My fiance is starting to lose interest in the restaurant since it closes early at 3 pm now, and I feel pretty sad but understandable as to why he is losing interest. After the third time when we stopped by and it said closing hours are 3, even I started to lose some interest in the restaurant since I don't get out of work and classes until 5 pm.

The food is very delicious and the atmosphere is always so welcoming. However, I feel as if the hours could be improved on. When it used to have closing hours at 8 pm on the weekdays, it was perfect for my fiance and I to meet up after classes and have a nice dinner together. Oh well, can't have best of both worlds!

Other than that, I do recommend for everyone to try this place out. You will be guaranteed to have a good time and an enjoyable experience!
Soo good!! After a night of partying, I needed a good solid meal in my belly and their biscuits and gravy hit the spot! ! Very home made tasting! Cute place too!

Again we love this restaurant !! Food is delicious , reasonably priced and Great service from J.R.  . And you have to go on Friday the clam chowder was amazing. Took them awhile to get up and going but if you tried it before and were a little unsure make another trip , it's well worth it


Very disappointed !! Loved this restaurant, my family and I used to go every other Friday , but for the last two months they have not been open on Friday at 5:00 pm.. I understand if your not getting enough business to stay open for dinner ,but what upsets me the most is I actually called there this morning and was told "yes" they would be open for dinner. I even passed it on my way home from work at 4:15 pm and there were cars in front and yet 30 minutes later after I picked up the other four family members and drove there they were closed. They just lost us as customers. We will not be trying to have dinner there again..

5/1/2018  Stopped in for breakfast/early lunch.  The place was clean, cheerful, and homey.  We were seated immediately and given menus and our drink order was taken.  I ordered the breakfast Chicken Fried Steak with 2 eggs, gravy, potatoes, English muffins, and coffee ($12).  My guest had 1 biscuit, gravy, potatoes, bacon, and coffee.  Our orders came out in a reasonable time and our server made sure our coffee and drinks were refilled when needed.  My guest enjoyed her meal while I felt the gravy could have had a little more flavor and my Steak, while cooked properly, looked as if it had a little freezer burn on the edge.  All the dishes coming from the kitchen looked appetizing and the customers seemed happy.  The restaurant had some "oldies" playing and there was a good atmosphere in the place, even as it got busier as we ate.  I would recommend giving this place a try.

Okay...our experience stopping into this establishment tops the cake of the truly "stupid and weird" experience category. Came in with a group of three and were greeted nicely at first; and seated right away. The hostess hands us clipboards with at least 10 sheets each of copy paper; and walks away while we figure out what just happened. We're all removing the pages from these old nasty wooden clipboards; to find that the menu is strewn like a slop shop all over these pages. To over dramatize this further, we couldn't even see the tops of the pages until we removed them; as they were being blocked by the clips on the boards. How utterly f'n annoying! What's worse is that the menu pages are completely out of order; with breakfast lunch dinner and other misc pages all thrown together in a mixed up cluster. Then the hostess comes back and see's that one of us was somewhat perturbed; and goes into a lazy explanation as to why the menus look this way. (btw - we just wanted to eat, not be lectured!) She states that she is the owner, and that her & her husband have come to Vegas from the Midwest; and have failed to make real menu's because they were waiting to see if their business succeeded into a second location. She further indicated that a new location was coming soon, and that only then would they get this menu debacle under control. At this point we were good with the explanation that we didn't even ask for. In fact, the only reason we came in here for our first visit, was to possibly eat some good food. The time was around 1:30pm on a Saturday afternoon; we were then greeted by our waiter and proceeded to order. All of us wanted to order dinner's, since we were really looking forward to their specialties; to be then told that they were not serving any dinners. WTF?? The menu states that dinner's are served starting from 10am daily; with exception to baked potatoes which were only available after 4pm. To make things even more bizarre, the restaurant closes at 3pm daily. So how does anyone order dinner's if they can't be ordered at all. So I guess baked potatoes aren't ever available either; since they are only available after 4pm once the restaurant has been closed already at 3pm? Seriously folks...maybe you can get away with this bs in the Midwest; but this is Las Vegas! Home to customers that want anything and everything whenever and wherever they visit; the flip side being they will simply leave your establishment and never be back, just like us if they cannot even simply order what you offer on your menu! There's always a restaurant's replacement right around the corner, and bs like this will always send us and other's right out your doors. Think that your wallet's won't be harmed by such? Think again, since those who care to go out of their way to grace your establishment, will in fact spend the most $$$. Cash in customers' wallets stays in customers' wallets, when your practices are this discombobulated! To top it all off, we all felt like the hostess/owner had a bit of attitude; which obviously was on purpose when she heard menu frustration from one of us. Ohhh poo poo...did we hurt your little feelings by expressing our dismay front & center over your shortcomings? Tough s**t, get your act together and be a real Las Vegas restaurant; otherwise go back to the Midwest and boil some potatoes out back. Sorry to be so rude, but your actions upon us as hungry customers; not even being able to order any food due to STUPID BUSINESS PRACTICES gets you one of these good ol' sour yelp reviews. TIP 1: Don't give people menu's with dinner's available when no dinner's are available. TIP 2: Make some REAL menus! TIP 3: Treat every customer as if they were the future of your businesses success, because THEY ARE! TIP 4: Don't ever let customers' leave your restaurant without being able to order food; as letting customers leave hungry & miffed will always cost you $$$ and future business.

Called an hour ahead of time to see if they served breakfast all day, yes they said. Sweet, drove 8 miles to check this place out and they were closed. Yup, closed. I called back to see what's up and they said they just decided to randomly close for the day? WTF? I just galkex to u on the phone an hour ago?? Thanks for wasting my time hometown eats, U SUCK!

Nice little kitschy joint off Tropicana and Pecos...I'd hate to be the one who has to dust all the trinkets that adorn this place! Food was good though and the staff were quite friendly. Very home style menu, meatloaf, salisbury steak, fried chicken...you get the idea. I had the french dip sandwich which was good, a little different with more of a pot roast type pulled beef rather than the thin sliced steak you might be used to. Still good, but different. Home made horseradish wasn't as hot as I'd prefer though. Would definitely come again, few more things on the menu I'd like to try.

I had a great experience here. Staff was friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Food was great ! And we went around 4 surprisingly just one more family was there so it was nice and quiet hearing great oldies

Frendly staff. The servers were kind and worked together. Portions were generous, food was pretty good. Chicken fried steak was a little chewy... but I kinda think that is common for the dish. All of the sides made up for it. Great mashed potatoes, mixed vegetables were divine and  side salad was really fresh and yummy. Pizza is huge! The breakfast dishes look good... I saw someone at a window booth with French Toast and it convinced me to go in! A million percent better than Dennys! Especially the one near nellis and Charleston... yuck! Anyways, the decor is warm and inviting like going to your favorite grandma's house fresh off of a remodel. Cozy with lots of natural light.

We went there one morning for breakfast, and we stood at the door without being seated or acknowledged other than "Be with you in a minute" for 5 minutes.  When we finally got seated, we sat for another 15 minutes without being acknowledged by a server or having our drink order taken.  We left and let them know that that was the reason for us leaving.  They smiled and laughed.  Worst service ever.  We will NOT be going back, regardless of how good their food may be since we never got to taste it.

I ordered the French toast with eggs and sausage for dinner. I love a place that offers breakfast all day long :) Great portions and price. There was a great Americana feel to the decor and I loved the oldies music that played in the background. It's a convenient location for us and will be back soon!

We called 15 minutes prior to 7 to let them know we had a party of 18 coming for father's day. First the guy asked us to change our time, when we told him we couldn't, due to work for some and unable to reach others, the guy said ok. Our party started to arrive about 7:10am to an establishment that opened at 7am only to find the doors still locked. Someone finally came out and told them, they weren't gonna open until 9am. DO NOT GO HERE, THEY RUINED 3 FATHERS DAYS FOR MY FAMILY. we have always been about supporting our local restaurants, now we are at a big name restaurant and loving our family. NEVER AGAIN Hometown Eats

Wanted to try some place new and this was on our way. Staff was super friendly and the food was good. Like going to your grandmas for a meal. My hubby got the smokehouse brisket hash and I got the chicken fried steak based on recommended yelp and our server. The food definitely has a homemade taste which is good. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that they brought out my husbands plate and apparently another server grabbed my meal for her table. I had to wait at least another 20 minutes for my food. I insisted the hubby eat since his food was getting cold. It wasn't our servers fault and I actually felt bad for him since he was a little upset. They were apologetic but that was it. I didn't expect a comp but they didn't offer anything for the error. There is a 10% off when you check in so we took advantage of that. I would give them another go as the food wasn't bad. The chicken fried steak tasted homemade and not the generic frozen patty. The only thing we weren't crazy about was their home fries which tasted like boiled potatoes put on the grill for a few minutes. I think I would get hash browns. They just weren't crispy enough for my taste. Not bad at all!

We went for dinner, and we were the only ones in the restaurant. The server said they only recently starting opening for dinner, so the word wasn't out yet. The food was fantastic!  I wish I lived in Vegas so I could frequent this place. We had nachos, turkey BLT, and a chicken fried steak breakfast. All highly recommended.  The menu goes on for miles; if you can think of it, they probably have it. The server couldn't have been nicer. Loved it.

Love this place! We come here at least twice a month. Quiet and cozy--comfortable atmosphere. The food here is great! Good quality comfort food at a reasonable price. We LOVE the Mac and cheese--but really everything we've had here is awesome.

Love this place! The food is always so fresh and delicious. The staff is friendlier than any other restaurant we frequent. Good family people. My husband normally gets the country fried steak and I go for the California omelette. Neat country style decor as well.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!  Cute restaurant! Good home cooking, friendly staff and a nice warm atmosphere. I had the pot roast my BF had stroganoff both were delicious dnd the soup forget the cup, order a bowl.  
This place is worth a try! It's a great place for for pie and coffee !!!
Okay, I've now been for breakfast and dinner - all I can say is impressive.

First of all this place has amazing customer service. They pride themselves in everything is made to order nothing is frozen. Karla was our server she was very attentive. Danny also served our food he was helpful as well. The owner came over and checked on us. I had the chicken tenders and they were excellent just like I make at home very crispy and juicy. My hubby had the fish and chips very tasty as well finally our daughter had the cheeseburger and she finished it all she hardly finishes anything. The fries were made from fresh potatoes just cut that morning. Excellent place for a homey diner feel. Great food. We can't wait till to come back for breakfast.
Fresh food that it takes a moment for it to come out. Glad I found this gem, I have been going at least once a week. Must go!

I placed an order with Bite Squad....after waiting 1 hour and 15 minutes....I was told the restaurant refused to make the take out order. Bite Squad attempted to have order honored by restaurant but the restaurant refused. Poor service.

Came here cuz it was nearby and my roommate is on a quest to find the best sausage gravy in town! Alas this one wasn't it , theirs  is country gravy as I was told !! Lol 
I ordered a oj which if it was fresh it was good but if it was bottled it was excellent , perfect pulp ratio , for breakfast I ordered the chicken fried chicken with eggs  over medium and home fries/ country potatoes , everything I had was perfection , the chicken was cooked to perfection crispy on outside and juicy inside and served piping hot ! The potatoes were ample and cooked with small chunks of peppers and onions one word DELISH! Eggs were a perfect over medium, their sourdough toast was thick and again the perfect golden color , only problem with that I asked for extra butter and it was rather dry and maybe a butter oil? I asked and got extra butter on side and that was a quick remedy but toast was already cooled down and jelly/jam selection was generic and overly high fructose corn syrupy , which when everything else was fresh and delish , that was a bit of a let down, as for my friend which is the reason for a 4 instead of 5 star rating and I'm taking his word for it , was that everything on his plate was Luke warm , he did order hash browns and on menu says add extra 6 mins cuz they do make them fresh maybe that was the reason ??? But his coffee was just warm as well and gravy on his biscuits was as well ( that I could attest to ) all in all I enjoyed my breakfast and I am a big breakfast lover , this place did not disappoint!!

I have been here twice now. 

Once with my husband, and we had a pretty good experience. The food was good, and the portions were big. The second time with my son. Mom-son bonding time. The second time did not go as well. With the breakfast, you get potatoes. If you wish to switch to hash browns, they indicate on the menu that it will be a 15 minute wait, as they are never frozen. I love hash browns, and just had to have them. My son and I both chose them, and so we waited. And we waited. 

We had our coffee and water arrive, and then it was not refilled until breakfast was almost over. That is so frustrating. And the water had a weird taste. I could not even drink mine. We waited more than the 15 minutes for our hash browns, but it was okay since we were catching up. When our plates arrived, I was really bummed to find that they had not given me my hash browns. The server apologized and said that he would get them going right away. I decided that I would not be a bother, and took the potatoes instead. 

The food was good, and we both enjoyed our meals. That was the last we saw of our server for a long time. We could not catch his attention after we finished, as he appeared to be the only one working the front of the restaurant. It had gotten busy after we arrived. After finally getting his attention, we asked for a to-go box. We waited 20 minutes for a box. Unreal. We were here for about an hour and a half. Way too long. Food was good, but I am not in any hurry to return.
Went in for lunch with my family. The food was great! Prices are decent. Love the way this restaurant really makes you feel at home. Good service too!

I was out running errands on Saturday morning and saw this restaurant about the time I got hungry. It caught my attention because the windows were all decorated and inviting. It is decorated with antiques which really goes well with the antique mall in the same shopping center. It was just a nice friendly place. Everyone welcomed me and were very attentive. I had the Corned beef hash special. It was so yummy! Cook perfect! Good quality corned beef with a little bit of peppers and onion. Splendid! I perused the menu and there are quite a few dishes that I must go back and try. One of the great aspects of the restaurant is that kids eat free! Love love love that! I will bring my grandkids next time.

Best breakfast place in town.  Not fancy, just nice people and wow, the service is awesome.  Went in last week for breakfast, hostess took us to table, and we had water within seconds.  Took our order quickly, and food came out within minutes, hot and delicious.  I love the biscuits and gravy and my wife always gets the veggie omelet.  The home cooked potatoes are the best, and you get a lot for your money.  Have also had office luncheons here and they do a great job getting everything set up and the food comes out of the kitchen on time and exactly what we ordered.  Give these folks your business, you will truly enjoy the food.

Absolutely horrible service. Didn't even get a chance to try the food. Wanted to but couldn't even get a seat. They weren't busy but it seems they have one lady working as the host, cashier and as a he waitress. One guy as the bus boy and two cooks. She told us 3 times give her one second so she could seat us but she instead took 2 people's check and another persons order.   So after 10 minutes waiting there we left and another big family behind us left also. I guess the owner is making a ton of money because they didn't care. Probably would have gotten worse if we stayed since only one person was working.  My advice to anyone wanting to try this place. Make sure to our have nothing to do because your day will be spent here.  There just lucky you have to give at least a star here to post.

Our first impression was that Carla and Alejandra were very warm and welcoming, and this place gave us that local, hometown feel we haven't found in Vegas. We ordered the chicken club-- very juicy and the chicken was hand breaded and fried, and also shared the all American cheese burger with cheese fries and a side of gravy. In addition to our dinner selection and milkshake on the side, the music selection definitely gave that diner feel, Chubby Checker, Elvis, etc. The decor was abundant but homey and everything was very clean. 

To sum it up, we've confirmed plans to come back on Monday, and look forward to being made to feel so welcome again. 

Thanks, ladies!
friendly servers, home cooked meals, menu is great and cheap. Perfect for brunch with groups!
I had the huevos rancheros they where so good and the peach cobbler a la mode  so good.....  great service  very friendly staff

On a lazy Labor Day morning my husband and I woke up and decided we needed breakfast. I searched Yelp for a place with a decent review, and I also wanted it to not be too far from our house because we wanted to get back to loafing around fairly quickly -- such time is important on a 3-day weekend. 

American Eats had a decent review and as I read through some of the reviews I figured it would be a good shot, and hopefully not super packed. 

When we arrived there were a few other patrons, but we were seated quickly. I requested a de-caf coffee, my husband had chocolate milk. These were brought out promptly and our order was taken.

Unfortunately this is where things got a little "off". We waited, and waited. Then the server came back by and confirmed our orders again. After that I heard yelling from their open kitchen, requesting our orders quickly. I suppose the server had forgotten to put them in. Le sigh. 

I could dismiss the mistake, and I do -- it happens. But when the food arrived I wasn't WOW'd out of my mind. My Denver omelette was just OK - choppy, diced ham, kind of bland, and tiny chopped up peppers/onions. There was also a lack of cheddar cheese which made the omelette dry and somewhat unpalatable. When eggs are super dry, especially in an omelette it's a huge downer for me, someone who really enjoys a soft, exquisite egg dish. Eggs are meant to be gently cooked, not blazed to death, whatever form you are eating them in. The home-style potatoes were quite good, but the toast was like eating cardboard and barely buttered.

My husband received his French toast, and he got a sizable portion (a plus indeed!), and he said they were good. However, he did not receive his over-easy eggs he requested at the beginning -- I think because when our order was confirmed the second time, the eggs didn't get added. Luckily though they did not end up on our final receipt, which I appreciated. I think we would have requested them, but by that point we had already been at the restaurant for longer than we had expected to be.

All in all, I really did want to enjoy this place, but I don't think the food is as great as it could be. Honestly, the service mistake is something that I can dismiss as a once "oops" - but the food being mediocre is what will steer me away to the many other breakfast places in the valley.

They have excellent food and service here. The owner took my order, says he's from Indiana, and the food tastes mid western, reminds me of home in Michigan. The music is playing moderately and oldies that fill the restaurant. I'll be back for sure.

Oh my GOD!!! This place is the bomb. The best diner in Las Vegas, ever!!!!  The service is hella awesome. The iced tea and coffee are delicious. The food is absolutely amazing. It's a family owned and run place and it's absolutely my favorite spot for breakfast. I highly suggest the pulled pork hash. 

I thank my dad for turning me on to this place. It's our family's frequent place to get a great meal for a great price.

For a great old fashioned diner style meal, check this place out. I got a classic club and it was tasty!!  The turkey was clearly carved from the breast and the ham was thick cut. Bae got the nachos and they weren't quite what we expected. The chips are thick and house-made. The benefit to that is they hold up longer against cheese-sog. Once he got used to the texture of the thicker cut chips, he cleaned his plate. The waitress was very friendly and the food was prompt. They kept offering to get him something in place of the nachos since he was hesitant about the chips.  For those who live close we heard them getting set up on GrubHub so you're in luck for delivery soon!

Experience:  A friend told me about this spot, so I thought I'd bring my Grandpa since he lives fairly close. It was 3pm on a Friday. (I know...crazy early for dinner, but he's 96...at his age, they eat dinner shortly after I wake up).  

Facility:  What a cute diner. The inside has counter seats, tables and chairs in the middle, and booths along the Windows. It was very clean and had such cute decor. It was an eclectic mix of traditional knick knacks, but with cute little mini chandeliers on the ceiling. My Grandpa even mentioned how he was glad he wasn't on dusting duty here with all the knick knacks. 

Service:  The service was really good here. Super friendly and attentive. My Grandpa likes to give the wait staff in any restaurant a hard time, teasing of course, and JR hung right in there. Super nice guy!

Food:  The food was pretty decent. 
I ordered the chicken fried steak breakfast. It was good, but not the best I ever had. Being from the South, I am a connoisseur of chicken fried steak, so I'm just a tad finicky.  

Overall:  I would come back. The food is good, prices are reasonable, the diner is cute, and the staff is awesome!  :)

We went for breakfast today. This was our 2nd. time there. The food is very good, service excellent, large portions. I can't say it was cheap but we've paid the same else where. We will return , give them a try. We really need to support good restaurants any where close to the east side of town.

I decided to stray from my "usual" breakfast spot and boy was I glad I did! This place is awesome!  I was greeted immediately and seated promptly.  My server, Daniel,  was polite and knowledgeable about the menu. I had the pulled pork omelet and all I can say is that if you're thinking about it,  do it!  I'll post photos below. 

The decor is very cozy and all members of the staff were attentive. One thing that really caught my attention was that one of the tables near me were obvious regulars and one of the staff members came over to say hello to them.  I overheard them tell the diners that the last time they were there they had left a baby bottle and he saved it and washed it for them.  That just melted my heart! There aren't enough good,  honest people in the world anymore and it's nice to see that they still exist.

Food was great, portion wasn't on the larger side but still fine. They took drink order immediately but took a while to take food order. Staff was nice, place was clean. I'll have on my places to return and recommend.
This is a nice sized place with great service and good food. The decor is very quaint and cozy. My server, Karla was super sweet and accommodating.

My little brother & I love coming here on our days off. The staff is super friendly & kind. The atmosphere's very chill, it feels like time has stopped and you can just sit there enjoying their delicious home style foods and the company. 

The food there is extremely delicious and filling, like you just came home from school and your mom or grandma just finished making dinner. I highly recommend trying their clam chowder when available. 

If you like that small town family owned restaurant feel, this is definitely the place to be.

First experience wasn't great but every other time it was great!! Great food!

Love the hash. They even let me get it with kk potatoes. 

Super homey feel
Went there for breakfast for the first time today. Great meal!. Chicken fried steak was awesome. Eggs once over were perfect and the potatoes were to order. Going back for lunch tomorrow.
Highly recommend this place humberto (his name is hard to pronounce) is easy going really took care of us. Food was just what we wanted. Pancakes are on point.

Decided to try this place out. Ive seen plenty of businesses come and go at this location. The atmosphere is pleasant and music is oldies.  The service is awful and food is not very good from what we had. The server is nice and funny, but never ever checks on his tables. We saw him once and there was only 3 other people here. Our drinks never got refilled. The server is actually still talking to the table in front of us about his truck and where he lives. He is not attentive at all. The girl server came to refill my soda and when she came back she accidently spilled it all on me and the person in the next booth. She said sorry and asked if he would like a towel. She also can not remember what shes doing. We asked for ranch and she came back to our table asking if what we wanted again. We still have been sitting at this table for 15 mins or more waiting for a check or even a drink refill. This is some of the worst service i have ever had and the food is less than the equivalent of a dennys. Nothing special here to eat. And still after writing all this our server still hasn't come back.  I will never come back here and can't wait until this place goes out of business and this location gets another shot at a new restaurant. Final note. The only person in here that gave good service was the busser

Came in around 2:30 on a Sunday afternoon. I felt really horrible coming in late (30 mins before closing... yes, we were those people *sad face emoji*), but I was craving chicken fried chicken sooo bad. I actually have never been here before but one of my coworkers brought me back her leftovers one time & I couldn't stop craving it since then. 

We were seated right away & it was quite busy when we came in. I ordered the chicken fried chicken dinner with the cream of mushroom. OH MY GOODNESSSSS!!! I love cream of mushroom. The server told me that their cream of mushroom is homemade & it was seriously the best I've ever had. I will keep coming back here just for that lol. The dinner plate comes with the chicken, mashed potatoes, vegetables, and a choice of soup or salad. Let me tell you, the whole thing is MASSIVE. I was so hungry that I finished all of the chicken lol. What I like about their chicken is that it wasn't heavily battered. For something fried, it wasn't too heavy. I wish the mashed potatoes were hotter though lol. It came out kinda cold. The dinner roll was okay, a little burnt on the bottom. The vegetables were okay, you know just the usual steamed veggies. 

What really compels me to give this place 5 stars (besides their beautiful chicken fried chicken) is the service. Even though we came in so late, the staff was still so helpful and came and checked up on us frequently. I will definitely keep coming back here!
Slow service boutique diner biscuits and gravy nothing special but chicken fingers were worth coming back for.

Friendly service and decent American comfort food. I was greeted right away when I walked in and ordered to go. The menu is straight forward and I went with the country fried chicken dinner. The decor inside the  restaurant was country cozy and was clean. Service was friendly too. My dinner came with fries and steamed veggies. I also ordered the Mac n Cheese. The chicken was good, the fried were ok, and the Mac n Cheese was a bit bland. Was hoping for more cheesy flavor. I would come back to try some other things in the menu though. They serve breakfast too, so I'll give that a try next time.

I had the taco salad. The lettuce does not seem bagged and all the vegetables were very fresh, ground beef had just enough spice, the tortilla strips were fresh and crispy. Side of ranch dressing - homemade is very good. My daughter had a cheeseburger and fries. Excellent cheeseburger! Fresh made ground beef patty was very juicy, lots of cheese, the bun was soft. Hand cut french fries were so good! The service was excellent! Everyone was very friendly and very efficient.
Amazing place. All of the classics all home made. Excellent customer service and great tasting food. A large menu with large portions. Bring your appetite

A friend took me to this place and It really reminds me of a New England (country) theme with all the cutest decorations in a shabby chic atmosphere.

The place is larger than what I expected.  The food is good (I had a mexican dish wth pulled pork)...i didnt want the omelet...i substituted for scrambled eggs.

I highly suggest this quaint restaurant but get their early since their is limited space.

Walked in and was seated right away. Everyone was very nice and made sure you were happy. I got the small plate of biscuits and gravy with bacon and home potatoes. I was pleasantly surprised to see that my bacon was crispy (my fave) and I didn't even have to ask. They have flavored creamer for your coffee, which also makes my happy. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I will be back to try lunch and dinner.

Food was very good ordered the pork hash and the country fried steak. Check for two people was 30$ I did t give five stars because the service was very slow and there was only two other tables in the place

We had to wait a couple of minutes for a booth today.  The reason.... Because she needed to sweep under the booth.  WOW. We would have not cared about that but she did.  Everyone provided service with a smile and the food was amazing... Definitely going back

It was just okay. Typical breakfast food, nothing special. Could have made the same food at my house for $5 and it would have been better than the $30 spent here. They were out of hash browns so we had the breakfast potatoes which were only 1/2 cooked. Everything else was okay / pretty bland, run if the mill food. I would not go again.

I really appreciate the quality of service eating here! Everyone is incredibly friendly and the biscuits and gravy is pretty on point!  The chicken and waffles is pretty delicious too and is a pretty huge portion. I have eaten here wth my family a few times and its nice to be welcomed back every time as family! :)
Food was Great! Service is exceptional and FAST! Had breakfast, and will return again to try lunch!

Come hungry because you'll be leaving stuffed. 

I'm so happy that someone was finally able to succeed in this spot. This is our comfort food place near home.

They do special orders well. (No peppers, extra cheese). Food is consistently yummy. The service is attentive and speedy. Love the decor and oldies playing in the background.

This place has done itself proud. They where located on Lake Mead Pkwy in Henderson in a small corner location. The food and pricing was great but it was very short on space. We went by there to eat one day and it was closed with a sign saying they where moving to a new location in Las Vegas on the corner of Pecos and Russel. So I drove by to see where it was going to be.. Wow much bigger location, so now i was ready for them to reopen.. So the time had come. I took my family to dinner there ( oh yeah they use to close at 3 only did breakfast and lunch ) Now they are open till 10 pm. I was very happy to see they did not raise the prices with the new location added some wonderful new items and are the same very friendly bunch of employees. They did an outstanding job inside with decorations and making it feel warm.. and the tables are spaced a nice distance apart but you do not feel alone.. they have booths and tables and can accommodate much larger groups. Food was excellent and served nice and hot.. Portions are on the large side which gave me some lunch for the next day.. Please do yourself a favor and visit thier new location..

I am gonna give this place a very solid 4 star.

1.  They get this off the bat for being the only restaurant in the last 15 years to actually have people eat in the restaurant. I drive by this place every day to work and never have seen any cars there, breakfast, lunch or dinner!

2  The service - Owned by a local couple who moved their restaurant from old Henderson, I was wondering how this place would do since it is so far away from their client base .  The service is great, the owners and their staff are very consistent and friendly.  This is a local place, family owned and they make you feel pretty darn comfortable.

3.  The food - 

Everything here is great!  I have had:

Cobb Salad... this is full of stuff!
Garden Salad  ok, no garden salad is that good...
Pot Roast....yum the wife says this is the best ever in the city.
Meatloaf... very likeable.
Chili ....just the right amount of spice.
Omelettes... I have had a variety of them, skillets, to the basics. I order them with egg whites and they are just right for me.

They have fish, hamburgers, salads, southwestern / mexican flavored foods and so far, so good. I have been here about 8 times now and enjoy it quite a bit.

GK says....check it out!

I can't get enough of this place. Always greeted with a smile. It was very busy when i walked in with my family but it wasn't long before we were seated. The food is fresh, tasty and very well worth the price. Thank you Hometown Classic Eats for the hospitality!

I've been here twice. The first time was great. We were seated right away, our waiter was nice,and the food was very tasty. My boyfriend and I were seated by a couple who we could hear complain about everything. We could tell the man was not having a good time at all and was being rude to the staff. But the manager came out and dealt with the situation, kudos to him. I really don't see why the man was complaining, this was our first time here and we knew we would be back. 

On the second visit there were four of us and a child. We were the only ones waiting to be seated and it took around 10 min. The hostess told us they had a booth and we just needed to wait for it to be cleaned and it would take 2 minutes. This was frustrating when I could see the staff do everything but clean our potential booth. This and my mom finding a crumb in her coffee were the only negatives. I ordered the southwest hash and have a new favorite! I would gladly come back, the food so far has been great and the staff friendly.

Burger was good a bit on the small side but still filling 
My daughter chicken fingers a bit dry...
Service was great and friendly 
Will come back for breakfast...next review

This is the third time I came and they are close such a disappointment because I was looking forward to eating here, the lady was rude to me, didn't even want to open the door to tell me personally, she just drove her hand across her neck from across the door.

Food was good. I ordered the special of the day and they ran out of it. Oredered my drink they ran out of it also..The menu is on regular paper like the ones you use in school. I've never seen that before, you could barely read the menu. Won't be coming hear again.

Really cute dinner with great service. We enjoyed the food and the music. There are not a lot of cafes on this side of town. It's a nice break from the fast paced restaurants. We will definitely be coming back.

I came here about 2 weeks ago with a party of 14 for a coworkers moving away dinner.
They were very accommodating for our party and moved furniture around so that we could all sit together. 
Our waiter was very attentive and patient with all of us. 
He was friendly and prompt with service. 
We had stragglers from our group that came in 5-10 minutes after the rest of us had already ordered our meals and they timed it greatly to where our stragglers were served within minutes of the rest of us.
All of my coworkers had great things to say about their meals. 
I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with fries and it was decent. 
As this place is relatively close to our office, a few of us will be returning for to enjoy lunch here as well to try more of the menu items as we all had a tough time deciding what to order.

I am always looking for a great place to have breakfast and I think I found it with Hometown Eats, the food was  delicious served hot and fast tasted like everything was prepared fresh. The resturant itself was bright and cheery and very comfortable, this place is a thowback from the old days and you will not be disapointed with the food. If you want a great breakfast, this is the place!

Great food , Jackie was the best, very attentive and so pleasant, fast service , great prices, the best thing was the food, perfect burger with home made style fries and the kitchen was so efficient, almost no time at all and our meal was on the table.

This trip not so good , French dip was different than any I have ever had, 
They seemed to be under staffed, and not so efficient, fries were still great but the  dip ? Don't order it.

We are regulars after one visit, great job!! Price, portions, flavor, service and overall value: they deserve five stars because this place excels above and beyond in each category. Everything is homemade and fresh, right down to the slice of orange used for a garnish. Breakfast served anytime.... How can you beat that? Or $23 for dinner for two people? You can't, which is why you must give this place a shot.

Great variety in the offerings the fruit option is always appreciated. . Flexibility in ordering was easy. Atmosphere is light and inviting. Quick service with large booths and tables. 
Specializing in chicken fried steak so we'll return.

Been wanting to try this place for awhile now since we live so close by. Once we tried to go for dinner but they were closed ? They have unusual hours.
So finally ended up here on a Saturday afternoon around 2:30/ 3:00 pm. I must say I love the feel of diners and the homey atmosphere.The menu's are served on a clip board which is strange not sure why you would need the clip board since you are not writing anything ?
I ordered the Pulled Pork Hash. It came with under cooked potatoes and a dry English muffin.
Overall the taste was ok probably wouldn't order it again though. My husband ordered just a regular cheeseburger no frills just simple. When it arrived it appeared to be kid sized and the ketchup had a horrible taste to it.Every one in the place is very sweet and nice.Price to me was expensive for the quality and portion of food. I will give this place another try I don't like to give up after just one mediocre.Hopefully next time I will be more thrilled !

Have been here twice for breakfast and I have to say I was pleased. I had the chicken fried steak the first time with hash brown and toast. Their steak was tender and their hashbrown a were cooked perfectly! The second time i I came here I had their pulled pork breakfast and it was amazing! Very tender. The staff is super friendly and the price I reasonable. My only one teeny tiny complaint is for a small orange juice it's almost 5.00 so with that being said I'll take a soft drink or water next time lol. The atmosphere is quiet and the Decor is classic American country "ish" lol Great place to eat will definitely be coming back.

Great breakfast and lunch spot potatoes were just rite eggs cooked perfect California omelette big and fresh ingredients bacon Crisp and not greasy could use more flavor onions peppers garlic or herbs but otherwise a good place to have a nice meal the music is old fashion two tv screens for sports fans enjoy

We are from out of town and just happened upon this place looking for breakfast. We were not in a huge hurry but we did have somewhere to be soon. We had to wait a bit to be seated and to get our food but the lady who seemed to be in charge (owner?) was very apologetic and very nice. They had a very large party get there right before us so the wait was understandable. When we got our meal we were very glad we waited. We both loved our food and I would definitely go back if we lived here!! I had biscuits, gravy, bacon and potatoes. My husband said the chicken fried steak was the best he's ever had!

Ok so they probably have the friendliest staff ever!! The energy here was very inviting and everyone greeted me and made sure I had everything I needed. The food was fresh, delicious and made to order. I was so impressed by the warm welcome and cute decorations that I was already texting family and friends about Hometown eats and how they must try it BEFORE my food came. I ordered the California Omelette and was very pleased with it. I will for sure be back here and will bring my daughter. 

Seriously give this place a try!! You will not be disappointed

First visit and it won't be my last.

Service was good; around when needed but never hovering.   My biggest complaint of most restaurants food is cold.  Not here, food arrived hot and pleasing to the eyes.  I ordered "Chilli Cheese" omlette.  Good balance of chilli to cheese and filling to eggs.  Two egg omlette was perfect size.  

Overall:  Great Breakfast, lots of options.

Food is pretty ok. The service is good. I should have read my previous review before going. They are still showing Fox News. There is no way that I can enjoy a meal when I have to look up and see Any News and especially Fox News. I just don't get it. But I don't have to worry, because I won't return. I'll ask my friends that I've taken there not to return as well.

Every now and then you walk into a place and wonder why did I come here. I had read the reviews on here and wanted to try it. I really wanted to try their Chicken Fried Steak! After what seemed like an eternity someone shouted from the kitchen area to have a seat (the sign says wait for hostess) . After another eternity a man that hadn't shave for a month can and said "What ya want?", he did bring a menu. I got my coffee and asked if I could order. There was a yellow specials menu on the table and I said "I'll" have the Number 3. He grabbed the menu from me rather abruptly and said "That isn't good now!" I left! I asked at the front to speak to the manager and Mr. Clean Shave said "I am the manager!"  Maybe it would have helped if I spoke Spanish. NEVER again for me!

I went here with a family of 7 and one being a child. First I truly hate writing bad reviews but I would like to give people a heads up. This place should be two $$ beacuse we sent $75 before the tip and we all pretty much eat off of the smaller portion menu. But the thing that bothered me the most is they didnt even have a kids menu!! Who doesnt have a kids menu, and they didnt have apple juice. I noticed that most of the people that were coming in all had kids. Lol so if you have a child 8 and younger your going to spend way to much on their meal. They also gave a 4 year old a glass cup. 

As for the food it was nothing to rave about. There are much better options.... I would have rather gone somewhere more family friendly.  Oh and the menu is on a clipboard. Classy
Back for another visit. Ordered chicken fried steak and eggso for breakfast. Best in town hands down. WOW. Fresh, flavorful, tender, wonderful. Keep up the great work.

I wanted this place to be a 5 but it fell short for me.  The French dip was basically a pot roast repurposed on a bun with au jus on the side.  Breakfast was better!  I didn't get a chance to try to pie but it was homemade and looked delicious.

We wanted something quick but not fast food and saw this place, thought we would try it. We were pleasantly surprised. We had the chicken fingers and were very happy with them. They were crispy and tender at the same time. They were breaded there at the restaurant not prepackaged.  They were delicious and came with a large order of deliciously crispy french fries.  My 19 year old son actually went out of his way to take his friend there on another occasion so they could get chicken fingers there again because hes always looking for good chicken fingers and was craving theirs. The owner was very nice and stopped by our table to see how we were doing. You can tell he takes pride in his business and really wants it to be a success.  Very comfortable atmosphere.

Great diner! Lovely staff!  The whole wait staff were very courteous and friendly. Especially Manny, great with the children... Good artist lol. Food was hot, fresh and delicious... Well worth the wait, although the waitress did get y order incorrect and I did not receive my food until my family was almost done eating.. Because of the wait to remake chicken fried steak. Hence the 3 stars.Homemade taste and a cool homely place.

I took my cousin here for breakfast. The place was packed but that didn't have any impact on the quality of service we received.  The entire wait staff was super friendly and made sure our drinks were never empty.  Our food came out pretty fast too and was simply delicious.   You get a lot of good food at a decent price.

Great food awful service.  They are not equipped to handle large parties of guest on a Sunday.  Had to wait 10 minutes to be seated and another 10 minutes before a waitress took the order.  Later found they got robbed the day before, sorry but that is not a good enough reason to not give good service.  Maybe next time it will be better!

Really enjoyed this place. wait staff was attentive and patiently explained differences in menu items. It's just the kind of place for a leisurely meal, because many items are prepared from scratch to accommodate preferences and freshness. Great!

This was a very nice diner. Cute Americana atmosphere. Came with my husband and in laws. It's the day before thanksgiving and they're heading to Mexico and wanted thanksgiving dinner. Both ordered the turkey dinner and it was great. My husband ordered breakfast chicken fried steak and eggs and loved it. I had the cheeseburger and fries. All of them were great. Food came out in a timely manner and was tasty. Staff was friendly and attentive. The check in offer was cool too 10% off. Would recommend.

Make it 3.5 stars, but I went down because it took so long to actually take my order. I rolled in here and was quickly seated at the counter (only person there). This place is fairly large and it sounded like they had a larger party in the back that I couldn't see, so I will give them the benefit of the doubt on the slower service. 

This isn't gourmet or fancy food. Just good old fashioned regular food at decent prices. I actually liked the fact I could get French Toast and Bacon for $5 off the Kids/Those who don't eat much menu. The plates I saw come out were full of food, more than I needed. 

French Toast wasn't on fancy bread, just regular, and the bacon was tasty. It was good and served with plenty of butter and syrup. Exactly what I was looking for. Iced tea was that type that lacked flavor so maybe skip ordering that. 

Nice decorations with lots of friendly signs saying things like "Love Laugh LIve" and similar sayings. Two TV's to watch the football games overhang the dining area. The cook was a nice lady who gave me a smile and told me she'd get my food out quick and she did. Bonus points there. 

I'll be back because its clean, convenient, and fair priced. Will have to try the chicken fried steak next time.
Coffee is great! Food is great! Service is great! The place is clean and so are the dishes they serve, its not just slapped on the plate!  I will be a frequent customer.
Seriously DENNY's who? What used to be Denny's is now people who care and food that it special old school diner style we love it here don't waste your money anywhere else if you do its your BAD!!!!

Such a great little place to eat with the family. Whether you dine in or take out, food will always be top notch! The chicken fingers are hands down the best in town! You can tell everything is made from scratch.

This place is soooo good the food is fresh....If you like good hometown cooking this is the place....if you want fresh...this is the place.....Try there
Denver omelet.....so good.....they are no longer open for dinner...closes
at 3pm.....since Aug/2017

Great food, prices and service.  Hometown is a family diner with a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.  I love their breakfast omelet and their senior specials are solid.  8 bucks from 2-5. They are also pending a liquor license.  Plenty of parking and roomy booths and tables inside.
We like going here for breakfast the eggs Benedict is delicious the portions are a good size and the prices are great it's also a very cute dinner with a lot of charm

Horrible horrible service. When we walked in, servers walked past the front host stand without even a simple hello, it wasn't until the manager or owner came by, that we were greeted. Once we got sat and the waitress took our order, not only was the order completely messed up when it came out, but she also forgot to put it in, because tables that came in after us were completely finished with their meal before food even hit our table. I asked her if she forgot and she got defensive saying that she hadn't. When the food came out, it came out one plate at a time so we all ate at different times. The manager / owner said she would take care of it, after I let her know that we had somewhere to be and took a whopping ten dollars off of our bill. I am not one to complain, as I work in a restaurant as well, but when you forget to put in an order and your guests wait over an hour to have breakfast, you apologize and make it right... especially when an anxious toddler is involved. I will NEVER come back to this place again. Awful.

Used to be a regular up until today.  I don't care too much for a wad of black hair with lent on it in my beef dip.  To top it off they said the would not make me pay for the sandwich but charged for the rest.  I guess our business is not needed

First timer and I must say. Not bad at all. Had the chicken Fried Steak Dinner. Only one minus was that there was not enough gravy on the steak. Other than that the meal was awesome.  I don't remember the last time I went to a place that makes everything from scratch. 

Definitely a place I'm coming back too.

Wish I could've given this restaurant five stars, but I simply can't, even though the food is well above average for this type of restaurant.

What cost them three stars is the wait time. Waited at least twenty minutes, probably closer to thirty, for a simple biscuits and gravy meal. I was engrossed reading news on my phone so lost track of time though had couple groups get up and leave while I sat here reading.

The thing that irks me the most is the restaurant wasn't overly busy as I came in after the lunch rush, which is typically one of the fastest times to get served. I can deal with delays when they're busy but it seemed as If this was negligence to some degree.

Once the waiter realized what went wrong had meal in a few minutes.

The food was pretty good, though it did suffer a little in taste due to my attitude after the wait.  Everything appears homemade from the potatoes to the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were exceptionally tasty.

But the wait....

The flavor of the food is truly amazing and unexpectedly great. If it wasn't for initial service would happily give restaurant five stars, or more!
